I was a little disappointed after using it for a month. Sometimes the sounds glitches while I am listening to the music even when my phone is in my pocket. I even tried to reset it twice and still have the same issues. Hopefully an update will fix this issues.
The battery life is great. I love all the features. The best part is setting the buds up and how easy and smooth to pair with my S9 plus. The buds sounds better than the wired AKG buds that came with S9 Plus. They are pretty small and fits my ears but they are not very comfortable after listening to the music for an hour or two. You will feel that the buds are in your ears.

author: Dinah Ann
title: Poor Sound quality and Connectivity issuses
content: The product is decent. It automatically pairs once you place the buds into your ear, you can use one bud at a time and the tap features work perfectly. The sound is ok. It sounds similar to my old beats performances (but those haven't sounded good in months and I wanted an upgrade) Call quality is just ok when working properly I can hear everything perfectly but the person on the other end hears everything and claim that I am not clear. While finishing my work, I noticed an odd sound while talking with my device in my pocket. I had unpair and repair but the problem continued. Hopefully, this is a defected model but I have already planned a return and I am not planning on buying a new one. I will wait for a better version because I do like the style and its full functioning wireless features (which most buds do not have yet).

author: Bryan
title: BROKEN AND SOLD AS NEW
content: The left earphone was broken like someone stepped on it and tried to glue it back together. I couldnt figure out what the cracking popping noise my left ear was making until I looked closely and noticed the poor attempt at a repair. I cant imagine they would come like this from the factory. Also this isn't the first time I've been delivered an item sold as new but clearly used.

author: Rixa
title: Refurbished! Would have been nice to know!
content:
Just received these today to find out that they are refurbished. Not bothersome by itself.  However, nowhere on the seller's product page did it mention that these are refurbished. I read top to bottom three times and cannot find mention of this. It would have been nice to know what I was purchasing before buying it.

I cannot see how this is not a deceptive and an unethical practice. While I cannot speak to the quality and performance of the product yet, I am very upset that this was not made clear from the onset. You just get a card in the package stating with an 'oh, by the way, these are refurbished'.  I cannot recommend this seller for this reason.

author: RayL
title: Hot Garbage
content:
I bought these after reading the reviews and was looking forward to using them. These things cut out when my S9+ is in my pocket just 2 feet away. They are unusable. I updated the firmware, unpared, repared, deleted the app, reinstalled the app. Nothing works. These things are over priced hot garbage. I returned them. The $50 pair of Tozos I bought a couple months ago are better than these.
Also the sound quality isn’t that great either.

author: Kevin
title: First pair didn't work
content:
I bought these mainly to use at work and I need to hear outside noise so I can talk to customers and coworkers. The ambient noise feature is a must for me.  Got these delivered and installed the app to test them out aaaand.....the ambient sound feature didn't work. The proximity sensor in the left bud doesn't work so it thinks that only one bud is in and the ambient feature is disabled unless both buds are in your ears.  Huge deal breaker. I've placed an order for a replacement and will update the review accordingly, but after a quick Google search it looks like this is an extremely common problem with no solution.

Sound quality is great and they are very comfortable so far.

UPDATE:  Got the second pair and the proximity sensor works on this pair.  However, the ambient sound feature leaves much to be desired.  It doesn't work well and almost impossible to make out what others around you are saying with it turned on.  I do like them, but they don't work for what I was hoping to use them for.

author: Y. Kim
title: Works great indoors or inches from your head
content: So I bought a pair of galaxy buds off Amazon after reading about them online. Nice design, small and simple. That's where the good ended for me. The Galaxy Buds worked fine on my Galaxy 9+ when I used them indoors; however, if I walked outside with them the buds would begin to stutter and the connection would go in and out. I took every step I could find online to fix the issue. I spoke with Samsung customer service; more solutions other than to exchange the items. I called Verizon and spent an hour and half with their support and ended up changing my phone for another Galaxy 9+ under the assumption the problem was my phone. Got the new phone... same problems. I then exchanged the Galaxy Buds through Amazon. Got the new Galaxy Buds today... and well the new buds don't work either. My other bluetooth earbuds work fine. I returned the Galaxy Buds today for a refund. There seems to be a problem with the Galaxy Bud design. Either way I was very disappointed my experience with these earbuds. I've heard that because of the size of the buds, there's a lot of interference going through my pants pocket and through me to the buds. Well, I bought a cheaper pair of bluetooth earbuds, of similar size, that work perfectly on the first pair. Compared to the two Galaxy Buds I tried. Plus you would think that the assumption would be that a person would carry their phone in their pocket or a some bag(either purse of satchel) not inches from their head; otherwise, it's just using your phone as normal.

author: jyh
title: Extremely Dissapointed! (Will update later)
content: So I was very hyped when I bought these, the reviews were good and the headphones just seemed amazing. But when they arrived at my house... I couldn't open the box itself, of all problems, the box really??? There were black marks on the box that looked it has been wiped, there was a fingerprint on the bottom. The original seal was ripped and there was another seal on top of it that doesn't look like the original. I couldn't get the box to open no matter what, some of the sides were glued shut when I tried getting my fingers in, the only way to open it was to cut it open. It seemed like someone used it and returned it. I decided not to open it and just return the thing itself. BEWARE: The seller was Amazon. If you are buying this I wouldn't buy it with Amazon as the seller, in fact just go on to the Samsung website and buy it unless you have prime. I'm reordering these and will update my review when I get them.

author: Lawrence J. Ulm
title: Best if used with a Samsung phone
content: Great on everything except I have the case on a belt clip but the case opens to easily and I've had to pick them up off of the floor.  Otherwise great sound, much better than my daughters air pods.  Good life on the battery and nice features.

author: Natali Rozin
title: Very Good Sound Quality
content:
I received them yesterday and enjoyed them almost all night :} Very good sound for wireless buds, better than my daughter's Apple ;)
However, for the best sound quality, by my sound engineering experience, there is 3.5 mm out jack needed, and a good HiFi wired headphones such as B&O, Bose, or Sony :D if a you need to perform some simple sound engineering tricks using a smartphone :D
As for wireless buds, they have very good sound quality, good job Samasung.
While waiting my new galaxy from Samsung, I paired the buds with my LG V20!  LG V20 does not recognize Galaxy buds as a HiFi device (analog out B&O Play certified in V20 built for wired out only.. ) , but the installed galaxy buds plugin from Samsung does very good job - just needed to play with its settings.
I increased the sound volume to max in the buds, while in in my phone, the Bluetooth sound usually set <= to 60-70% - this gives better bass quality and very nice reach sound.
Will update my experience when receive my new Galaxy Note 10 by the end of Sept.

author: Prime1
title: Works individually, seamless setup, great battery
content:
WORKS INDIVIDUALLY: this was very important for me. They dont seem to have a "master bud" like some sets do, you can just take out 1 and use that one and then take out the other when the first ones battery dies. When you just use 1 bud then the long press volume only does what that bud is programmed to do, for example if I just use the left bud the long press will only turn the volume down and if I use the right bud the long press will turn the volume up. When using just 1 bud your media pauses when you take it out, if you use both then you have to take both out for it pause, or just tap once on the touchpad of either bud. Doesnt automatically play when you put them back in, you have to tap the touchpad to play.
MAKE SURE HAVE THE RIGHT TIPS IN AND HAVE THEM AS DEEP AS POSSIBLE FOR OPTIMAL SOUND QUALITY
SUPER EASY SETUP: on my s9+, just make sure you have the samsung wearables app. Auto connects when case opens if you have bluetooth on.
 AMBIENT NOISE: mode is kind of weird, probably not best in class but could be improved through software update. But you could definitley hear cars and loud voices if you have ambient mode turned up (only works when you have both buds in ears) There is an update you need to install when you connect for the first time that takes about 2 minutes.
3 different size buds and fins included. Wireless charging works on highpower and low power charging mats not just on the back of an s10 device, usbC charging also available.
Tiny wireless charging case, weak magnets hold the buds in and guide them to the charging pins, you can shake the buds out if you have the case open, stronger magnets hold the case closed in your pocket, good and solid clicky case, satisfying to open and close.
 CUSTOMIZATION: You can customize the "long press" on the touch pads to turn volume up and down, turn on ambient mode or activate the digital assistant of your choice.
UI: No buttons, just a touch pad that is very responsive and it has sensors to know if they are in your ear and the touchpad doesnt work unless they are in your ear so you wont accidentally change your music when you take them out. Touchpad can be impeaded by hair over your ear. These buds and the case are tiny, you could probably hide them if you have long hair. Be sure you like tight fitting in-ear buds, everyones ears are different.
SOUND: If you arent an audiophile they are great, I personally dont see much of a difference in any earbuds no matter the price, they do sound alot better the deeper into your ear you can put them. They dont seem to get ear bursting loud but they do get very loud, good bass punch.
No onboard storage like the iconx.
BATTERY: I have not ran them to their limits yet but while using just one bud I listened to 5.5 hours of podcast (mostly voice) at about 35% volume and after the 5.5 hours the bud still had 40% battery left. When that ones battery runs out you can switch to the other by just picking it up and putting the other one in the case to charge.
INSTANT PAIRING: when you open the case and have bluetooth on they connect in less than 10 seconds, I have not had the little pop up window show up like in the ads but they instantly connect when you have bluetooth on.
Great purchase if you like in-ear style buds, kind of like ear plugs. Most features only available on Android, Samsung phones apparently work best though, Iphone works with basic features and siri.

author: ThatNurseOverThere
title: I didn't know how much I would love them.
content: I take these everywhere. Gym, work, errands. They are sooo comfortable and stay in place soo well during a workout. Even after getting all sweaty. I show them off to everyone. I like these better than my BF's Bose headphones. And they are wayy less bulky. The sound is awesome and the Ambient Mode feature makes it so I'm not deaf to my surroundings in public.  The noise cancelling isn't Bose or $300 stereo headphone level but I can hear clearly and so can the person on the other line!

author: A. Kelcher
title: Very comfortable with some advice
content: I love these earbuds.  Samsung knows how to do it.  Very comfortable, nonintrusive and idiot proof.  I liked them so much I bought a second pair for me.  The user interface is clean and simple.  However, don't get bogged down by loading Samsung's Galaxy Wearable App.  It sounds good but too many permissions are requested to access all aspects of your phone.  Totally unnecessary if all your interested in is listening to music and calling folks.  I do not know why their app gives you the opportunity to select which processes to access but in the end if you said no to any permission request it just dies and leaves you in the mud.  ADVICE: do not download the app.  Just pair it like you pair any blue tooth device.

author: Robin S.
title: FINALLY! A nice set of earbuds!!
content:
My search for the best and most cost effective earbuds has not been a very easy or quick experience. I must have read literally HUNDREDS of reviews, saw many review videos, and tried and returned 7 different brands based on their recommendations, before I finally decided to go with the Galaxy earbuds. Honestly, I thought that I would never find a pair that sounded great with both phone and music, and had a decent battery life. You would think that the countless reviews on Amazon and other websites I looked at would make my decision easy, but this just wasn’t the case.

I actually found the reviews to be extremely unhelpful and so black and white that it made me completely confused. I would read 5 verified reviews praising a product for the exact same reason and then the next review would say that particular area of praise was shit. I mean really! Sometimes I think other brands have people do this to throw off potential buyers and if so it worked. But really, I just didn’t appreciate the sheer magnitude of this type of thing. It’s so frustrating as a potential customer to spend such a ridiculous amount of time trying to decipher which are true. We all have better things to do.

Ok so about these earbuds...This is everything you need to know without all the unnecessary crap.

These buds are extremely comfortable and come with several size rubber pieces to get a great fit.
Very reasonable price for such a great product.
They are the perfect size and not obtrusive at all. Also, the size of the case is very small so super easy to carry in a bag or your pocket.
You can touch gently to control your music, answer/hang up calls, etc.
They pair very easily to any Bluetooth and make a cool sound when they detect that they are in your ears. It’s automatic...
They have an app so if you have an Android you can download that allows you to customize your sound, ambient noise, and see any battery life remaining.
The sound for music is VERY good. They sound like you are in the front row of a concert. Rich, immersive, and not crazy base but definitely good base.
EVERYONE can hear me fine and not 1 person ever makes a comment or even knows I am on them. Also, I hear them great as well...Hallelujah! And you can use both (which gives the voice a stereo sound) OR you can just use one (either). If you take one out during a conversation the conversation keeps going without any disconnect.
They stay put when exercising, dancing, hanging upside down.
A voice says email or text when you get one.
The battery life is very good...I honestly haven’t counted the hours but I can wear them all day without any problem. I think I have maybe charged the case every few days or so...just depends on how long you are using them.

The ONLY negative for me is that they do seem to cut out for a second here and there when it’s windy outside. But for a very brief moment and that’s it. But really not a deal breaker at all, especially after I have experienced what else is out there.
Also, they might not be waterproof but they are sweat proof I think?

I hope this review has been helpful!

author: ly gro
title: Loooove these!
content: I was excited to try these since I was supposed to get them when I preordered my s10, but they ran out. I received these and when I opened them I was slightly shocked that there were no instructions included in the box. I charged them which was pretty easy to figure how to do. I'm not super tech savvy. Next I needed to figure out how to pair them. Luckily as soon as I opened them my phone sensed them and dinged. I didn't even have to Google! Sweet! Sound is great and they're working well. Awesome!

author: Jeff Caddell
title: Behind apples 2-year-old air pods. Such a disappointing purchase.
content: I don't usually write reviews, or bother others with my thoughts on things, but since Samsung had such a chance to hit a home run with these, but boy did they miss, I figured I'd help others who were looking for the same things I was in these. I listen to mostly podcasts, so the lackluster sound quality is ok, I can deal with that in, but the idea that irks me is the poor sound quality these have all around, not just in podcasts or music. I hate to hold a phone when talking on it, and everyone I have spoken to on these has been disappointed with how I sound to them (sounds like I'm an in a tinny room with lots of echoes), along with my disappointment in the sound quality of those on the other end as well.

author: Phillip
title: Don't listen to the haters! These buds survived 5+min swim in the deep end of my pool!
content:
I'm a HUGE fan of Samsung in general. I discovered them over a decade ago and I've been with Samsung ever since. Some may say that fact alone renders my review to be biased. But they'd be wrong. Very wrong. I'm possibly more skeptical than anyone you know.
I've heard all kinds of claims about these buds barely being sweat resistant. Well, I've been using mine DAILY, sweating like crazy down in Houston Texas as well, and I'm amazed by the resilience of these crazy comfortable and light as a feather - great sounding {wireless} earbuds!!!!
Both the charging case and the buds fell into the deep end of my pool today by accident. Normally I would have dove right in to retrieve my precious tech. But all of those (false) claims of their water resistance told me to write them off and buy another pair.
It took me roughly 5 mins to grab the skimmer and scoop them out.
No one believes this next part, but I don't leave extremely positive reviews for the adrenaline rush! Lol.. I kid you NOT- whenever I grabbed the charging case out of the skimmer net (with the buds still inside mind you) THEY WERE STILL CHARGING!
THE INSIDE WAS A LITTLE WET, BUT IT MADE ZERO DIFFERENCE WHATSOEVER! IT'S BEEN ABOUT 3 HRS SINCE THE INCIDENT AND I'M STILL JAMMING MY FAVORITE PLAYLIST!
I'm completely amazed by the sound quality, battery life, connectivity, durability, style, options, etc.. of these very reasonably priced buds!
These earbuds have even saved me unknown amounts of money in terms of phone cases and screen protectors and deductibles for refurbishing or replacing broken screens, cases, protectors, etc.. seemingly everytime I would set my phone down after changing a song or whatever it may be because of the corded earbuds yanking my phone off the table and onto the floor.
In short, the true wireless feature alone, at least for me, is more than worth it because these have truly has paid for themselves a few times over by this point.

That being said... one would think, that with all the new advancements in protective coatings of late, that Samsung would have made the outside layer of the charging case FAR MORE scratch resistant than they are. After maybe 3 days of very limited and controlled careful use, I could barely make out the lettering on the top and bottom of the case.
In retrospect, my small complaint is just my skepticism finding anything possible to critique.
I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE TRULY WIRELESS EARBUDS TO ALL SAMSUNG GALAXY FANS ESPECIALLY. BUT ALSO TO ANYONE WHO WOULD RATHER SPEND LESS $ ON QUALITY EARBUDS.

Oh, and 1 more thang... this ain't no fake review.
Buy you some ninja.

author: Sanban-Ookami
title: Better Than Expected
content:
Bought these out of impulse and can say i'm pretty impressed.

Pros:
1. Excellent sound(for stereo), for ear-pods. I mostly listen to rock and metal, quite satisfied with the sound, the bass mostly.
2. Battery lasts long enough without using the cradle. about 5+ hours at full volume without recharge.
3. Cradle is small enough for carrying in your pocket, about the same volume as Apple airpods.
4. They don't have noise canceling, but the tight seal they form while wearing them seem like they do. Just turn the volume up and you're good to go.

Cons(all of these have pretty simple solutions):
1. Battery doesn't last long enough, would trade a slightly bigger cradle for more than 7 hours of extra battery. (just being picky).
2. The low volume default setting was off-putting at first but managed to solved it.
3. Cradle material feels slightly fragile and cheap, as if i drop them a couple of times, it will crack.

I own QC35, QC20, MDR7506. Tested WH1000XM3, QC35 II. For being a quite small piece of electronic, they do pack a punch. just enough for my taste. Since i like to travel light, they will perfectly substitute my QC20s (hate the wires and the big noise canceling brick) for now.

EDIT 1: A Month In: Work great still, battery lasts as long as its intended. BUT, it bugs me when they are connected to my galaxy S9+ and i open my pc and the connection changes to my pc. I open the blutooth settings, manually disconect the earbuds from the pc and manually conect them to my phone again. WITHIN SECONDS they reconect to my pc again...rinse and repeat till im fed up and have to remove them entirely from my pc. Turning off the pc bluetooth is not an option since i have other devices conected to it. Happens when im in the car too, i start the radio and they instantly disconnect from my phone. Setting the car radio to audio only doesnt seem to fix it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good for what they are
content:
These work exactly as advertised. I've had zero connection issues with my s8+, and the battery life is very decent. I found the sound quality to be very clear, and the bass to be good, but not strong. They sound better than airpods, and they cancel noise very well, plus they don't leak sound at all, which makes these great for use in quiet environments.
Overall, these deserve to be recognized as a great purchase for any Samsung user.

author: Dennis Cabarle
title: On the fence
content:
I received these today and I have to say that I wish they were a little louder.  When I listen to music, I wanna go deaf.  I'm not kidding.

That being said, the sound quality really depends upon your source.  I listen to just about any type of music (no rap, no country, no jazz).  So I fired up a few different genres and tried different settings with all of them.  Keep in mind that the bitrate makes a huge difference.

A few bits of music I listened to with these headphone:

1.  Judge Jules Creamfields - 2000 - Old school trance - This sounds great but it wasn't loud enough.  This is Trance Energy and I like it loud.  Sound quality for this oldy was pretty damned good, just wish it was louder.

2.  Hans Zimmer - Da Vinci Code - Chevaliers De Sangreal - FLAC format.  The song gives me the chills but the bass was slightly washed out and the highs were absent.  Also, it wasn't loud enough for me.  DAMN!  This song is a great song to test a sound system with and these earbuds were a 5/10.  So unfortunate.

3.  Simple Minds Live - FLAC format -  Just not loud enough.  Could use a little help with the highs as well.  The lyrics were drowned out by the music.  Disappointed with this one.

4.  Van Halen - Runnin With the Devil - Cuz I love David Lee Roth.  This is a 3.43mb MP3.  Everything sounds great with this song.  My only gripe... VOLUME.  I wanna hear Diamond Dave SCREAM but that's not happening with these.

5.  The Church - Reptile - My only complaint...  I'm not deaf yet.  Okay...  The bass was a little dull but not terrible.

6.  The Police - Synchronicity II because it's bad ass.  Sound is a bit washed out on this 6.07mb MP3 but it's okay.

7.  Grateful Dead - Sugaree 1977 live - It's about as loud as you'd want for this song... eh... maybe not.  It's a little washed out but what do you want from a 1977 recording?  Okay so I realized for this song I was on Bass Boost.  Taking off of Bass Boost and putting the head phones into Dynamic mode makes a HUGE difference (No longer washed out).  Still could be louder though.

8.  David Bowie - Heroes -  Sounds okay - The Man Who Sold the Word sounds about the same.  Two of my favorites from Bowie.

9.  Spiritualized - Ladies and Gentlemen We are floating in Space - Never heard of Spiritualized?  This is a great band to test out new headphones with.  Such a complex song.  The dynamic mode works for this song and sounds great.  Bass boost mode isn't too shabby either.

10.  Pink Floyd - Sorrow (Pulse) - It's my favorite post Waters song; might even be my favorite Pink Floyd song ever.  Dynamic mode is best but it needs to be louder.  Guitar solo at the end of the song needs to make me deaf and it wasn't happening with these.  :(  Overall, the sound was pretty damned good for this recording.  Anyway, I'm sure this isn't the song you wanted me to review so let me review TIME (DSOM Studio version)...  This sounds absolutely amazing but for some reason, the headphones keep cutting in and out.  (I'm writing this review real-time.  I wonder if the earbuds are overheating, it's getting annoying?)  *Update an hour later and it's no longer cutting in and out (Sounds amazing just wish it was louder).

11.  Echo & The Bunnymen - People are Strange (Doors Cover).  Who does the Doors better than the Doors?  Echo...  This song sounds great.  Only gripe?  You guessed it, I'm not deaf yet.

12.  ColdPlay - A Rush Of Blood To the Head - Live - This sounds absolutely phenomenal.  Even the volume was loud enough.  Vocals are crystal clear, music is perfect...  Everything is excellent.  Dynamic Mode.  I had to listen to another one of these from the same live show to see if it was still perfect.  Politik - Sounds is absolutely amazing.  Blew me away.  If every song I've reviewed was as crisp and clear as these, I'd given a 10 star review.  WOW!

13.  Radio Head - Creep - not bad, not as loud and crisp as the Cold Play I just listen to but it's good.  Needs to be louder.

14.  Darude (Trance) - Finland - Old School Trance Energy - Sound is pretty good.  Just wish the highs were a little higher and crisper.  Overall I'd give this a 6/10. Tried different modes but Dynamic Mode sounds best.

15.  Bon Jovi - Livin' On a Prayer - Crisp good sound.  Greatest hits...  Sounds great, bass could be a little better but the highs are high and the dynamic range is pretty good.  Same thing for Wanted Dead or Alive.  Nice sound, you won't be disappointed.

16.  U2 - The Unforgettable Fire - Sounds kinda dull so I tried another U2 song from a much newer album... Achtung Baby - Love is Blindness.  Sounded much better but still, there's an awful lot of bass in this song and I think the highs and lows are getting lost.  Who's Gonna Ride Your Wild Horses Sounds better but still, the bass is a bit washed out.

17.  Sir Paul - Uncle Albert / Admiral Halsey - This sounded just fine.  Dynamic mode and Bass boost mode although dynamic was a bit more... dynamic (It expanded the highs a bit and got rid of the slight muffle).

18.  Metallica - Master of Puppets - So unsatisfying.  This is the remastered version on spotify.  Sounds great but this needs to be LOUD and it's not.  Same with, Enter Sandman.  Ride The Lightning - NOT LOUD ENOUGH.  WTF.  This needs to be much louder.  Even the live version was not loud enough, however, sounded pretty damn good.  "One" Live sounds pretty damn good.

That's all for now.  I reviewed a bunch of various genres in real time.  Here's the thing.  I find that the recording and bit rates are going to have a major factor with whether you can appreciate these or not.  Since I'm not an audiophile, I'd have to say that you'll experience similar disappointment with any headphone that's not geared for a specific type of music.

Overall, I'd have to say these are a 3.5 out of 5.  They need a little work.  I'm listening for a few hours now and I'm at 70%.  of a 95% charge.  That's not too shabby.

I had a phone call which wasn't a great experience.  The person on the other end asked if I was on a speaker phone.  I asked if I was coming in clear and they said, "Yes but it sounds like I'm on speaker".  The caller wasn't as clear as my 4yr old Plantronics earpiece either.

I'll come back in a few days and give another review.  This is my first day with them.

author: Leslie Joyce
title: Extremely Disappointed - Bad sound, bad for running
content: I had really high hopes for these. From everything I read, these buds were supposed to be much better than Samsung's iconX buds but they were a huge let down. I'm training for a marathon so I really wanted a pair that I could wear running totally hands free. Almost every run they would just stop working and I'd have to restart my phone. When I finally got them to work again, they would constantly cut out with almost every step I took. It was so incredibly frustrating. Even just walking they would cut out with my phone in my pocket. The only time I would have a good experience with them is at work when I was sitting at my desk doing nothing.  Sound quality was horrible even when it worked. I would really not recommend these at all.

author: MG
title: Wireless charging stopped working within 2 months. Warranty does not cover replacement.
content:
I bought these earphones on April 3, 2019. The wireless charging case stopped charging the earbuds in July 2019. These earbuds are used for the office to block out noise so there was very little wear and tear on the unit. I called Samsung customer care since it was within 1 year of purchase. Samsung sent me a wall plug and a charging cable...

After receiving the wall plug and charge cable, I called Samsung to ask why a wireless charging case was not sent out as discussed with the previous customer representative. The second customer rep apologized and told me that the one year Samsung warranty for the wireless earbuds does not cover the wireless case. My only option is to buy the entire set. I can't just buy the charging case.

Did I mention that I bought these wireless earbuds on April 3, 2019 and they stopped working July 2019? Great warranty Samsung. I should have bought a Jabra elite 65t instead. Really disappointed with this purchase and will never buy another Samsung mobile accessory again.

author: Adam Greene
title: Samsung hits a Homerun once again
content: First off I opened the presentation is perfect. I opened the ear bud case and my Galaxy S9 immediately notified me of a new set of buds in the area. Connection could not have been smoother. The only setting I had to change was the long hold initially set to activate Bixby. Thru the galaxy wear app I could change it to control volume. left side down, right side up. The fact that the buds are touch sensitive and not buttons is a huge selling point. A prior set had buttons which would have to be pressed firmly for up to 5 seconds to activate menus. these are just a light press or tap.  They are so light. hardly noticeable that they are even in with the exception of the music that is blasting out of them by personal preference.

author: Bonnie Chen
title: Noise cancellation is the best I've experienced
content:
OK now these aren't like Bose headphones or anything, but the noise cancellation on these are better than I expected!
I have these in on the subway to work and home playing music not even at max volume. The other day, there was an argument in the car next to mine, not even 20 feet away that involved the police once the train had stopped, and I DIDN'T EVEN NOTICE BECAUSE OF HOW WELL THE NOISE CANCELLATION WAS. I only noticed since people were looking back and we hadn't moved, once I press and held to turn on ambient noise mode I could hear yelling. I took out my buds and chaos to my ears. I was standing there as this lady was screaming at the police and remember being super impressed at how I didn't hear anything going on with these in.

I've never had wireless buds before so I was scared of them falling out but they haven't and it's a snug but comfortable fit. I'm really impressed by the touch technology and I like how my music/videos will pause if I take them out of my ears. Battery life of the case is ok to me. Disclaimer: I have a shell on my case, it doesn't come pink!

author: Ry-guy27
title: Great over all with some flaws
content:
They hold close to a six hour charge, they sound great (turn on Dynamic mode), play/pause controls are easy enough, calls sound fine, the case is pocketable, the buds are petite, and the fit is comfortably snug. I really love these things. But.....

The connection does otherwise suffer sometimes. I’ve had two sets of Galaxy Buds and used them with a few different phones. My biggest issue is an occasional lag where the earbuds will get out of sync with each other for a second (normally the left one), then sync back up. It’s jarring and seems to happen in crowded areas, possibly due to wireless interference.

voice calls are enhanced by a pair of microphones in each earbud that work to isolate your voice. The resulting audio is not what I’d call crystal clear, but callers could hear me.

author: Braden
title: Great overall, but not great for phone calls.
content:
The sound quality on these is quite good! The battery life is phenomenal, and they often last me nearly the entire duration of my 8 hour work shift. They're also very convenient to charge in the case, and they charge quickly, so you can get right back to listening. They fit comfortably (the wings took a few days to get used to. They used to hurt my ears a little bit, but now that I've grown accustomed, I don't notice it at all), and I've never worried that they'll fall out when I have the wings on.

My one complaint. Phone calls. When talking with people, I've had lots of complaints about me sounding pretty quiet and the background noise being really loud. If you're outside while on the phone, the mic picks up even the slightest breeze. It can make it pretty dofficult to communicate. It's not so bad if you're in a room without any background noise, but if you're in public or outside at all, it becomes a problem.

Other than that, they've been really great!

author: Marcelo Triana
title: Upgrade worthy? No. But still decent.
content:
Pros:
-Nice function for the case to be wireless charge-capable
-Earbuds are comfortable, have other size options if necessary
-Earbuds themselves turn on when in your ear, making them quite efficient for battery
-Easy connectivity with phone (using Samsung S9+)

Cons:
-Sound quality leaves much to be desired - using the equalizer in the Galaxy Wearable app is a must
-Lack of much customization for custom user commands with the long press
-Not waterproof (I bought another pair of wireless headphones for about $40 that were great and water resistant)
-Ambient Sound mode is a bit tough to really see the potential for at first (personal thing).

I like these headphones quite a bit. I've been a Samsung fella for some time, so I'm going to use these for longer and make an update later. These are mainly first impressions. However, if you're considering upgrading from another headset, I wouldn't really recommend it much unless you feel an actual need for the little quirks (ambient sound mode, touchpad instead of a button for functions).

author: GogTheHammer
title: Almost perfect
content:
I've tried many different wireless ear buds. This is my first totally wireless pair though. That part I love! The Galaxy Ear Buds connect very easily, have nice software features and work great with my Note 9.
They are almost perfect!
However, I still have the same problem with these as I've had with all wireless buds... little disconnects and stutters. It seems if you hold your head still and look straight forward, these keep a great connection but if you turn your head or look down much, it seems they break up some. I've been trying to pinpoint it but have yet to find a pattern.
While they work almost flawlessly, the sound and comfort of these are fantastic! My only complaint is the losing signal part. It doesn't happen a lot but enough to be annoying.
So, if you've had that problem in the past with ear buds or wireless in general, I don't think you will find these much different. The big difference in these is the easy setup with the phone, the instant connection when you pull them out and put them in and the sounds quality which I find to be pretty dang good. I think the price is pretty good too.  I just wish someone could tame the disconnect/stutter beast with wireless!

author: Ethan S.
title: Eh they ight
content: The only reason I didn’t get air pods was because they don’t fit in my ear properly. Although the galaxy buds did fit fine and feel comfortable. I have an iPhone and at first it was a pain in the ass to connect to them, sometimes they would say connected but not play any sound or show proper signs of functioning. After a month the left ear bud crapped out, the case opens and the ear buds going flying if you drop them. Honestly just purchase air pods and some little rubber ear buds to fit ur ear better if that’s the case. Galaxy buds also weren’t loud enough just by a little bit, and if you have an iPhone you do not yet have access to the app that allows you to change different settings and set them to the way you want them to work for you.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Bad at the basics
content:
Fundamentally a set of wireless headphones need to only do a couple of things: maintain a stable connection to the phone, take calls, and play music. Thinks like noise cancellation (which these don't actually do), isolation (which they do well), ambient noise passthrough, good battery life, and the like? Those are just nice to have.

The Galaxy Buds do a lot of those nice-to-have things, but they don't do the basics especially well.

Pros:
+ Great sound isolation (note: they don't have active noise cancelling)
+ Great battery life
+ Some fancy advanced features like ambient noise, equalizer, touch controls that work well, etc.

Cons:
- Connection quality is poor. If I keep my phone (a Note 9; another Samsung product) in my left pocket, and turn my head to the right, they will cut out. The connection is often static-filled even when the phone is sitting on my desk, five feet away, with a clear line of sight.
- Microphone stops working after a while. I have a lot of conference calls for work, where I'm often sitting on mute. If I need to speak later on in the call, I'll take the phone off mute, but the microphone has stopped working. I can disconnect the buds and use the phone speaker fine.
- Microphone quality is poor. I've had a number of complaints about my voice quality while using the Galaxy Buds. That didn't happen with my Airpods.

author: Dee
title: The fit
content:
I bought this product about 1.5 months ago before writing this review.  If not for the fit issues, I would have rated this a 5.  But the fit of the buds in my ear are a big factor and a disappointment.  Other than that, everything else is ok.  I am just dissatisfied with the fit.  After seeing family members with the Apple Airpods, I was considering purchasing those (before buds came out). Although I wouldn't get the full benefit of the Airpods being that I own an Android Samsung device, they looked to be a good option for hands-free.  I was excited when Samsung came out with the Galaxy Buds for their devices.  I could now have something similar to Airpods to cater to the device I own. But I became disappointed when I realized the buds do not fit comfortably in my ear. I have tried all 3 of the supplied eartips/wingtips.  I can be walking and one would fall out of my ear.  I have to be careful how I move about because they are just not secure. I am hesitant in using them when working out for fear of losing one. Even now, sitting at my desk at work, they feel as though they are about to fall out.  I wanted to love them so bad but it just hasn't worked out for me. Sadly

Updated comment: They did fall out my ear while I was sitting at my desk. Annoying and aggravating. Especially to have paid for something. I hate I waited until return period had expired.

author: JM
title: Defective
content: This is my second pair in three months to exhibit the same defect! The right earbud gets very quiet. There's no fix for it. Many people online are complaining of the exact same problem! Samsung chalks it up to a cleaning issue, which it is not, and offers to replace the earbuds. Who wants to continuously replace earbuds every 1-2 months! In addition, Samsung takes 2 weeks to deliver the replacements. Refunds from Amazon are only allowed for 30 days, so you are stuck. There are plenty of better options available now. Shame on you, Samsung!

author: Nice Watch
title: Great sound, questionable mic
content:
Overall, I'm definitely pleased with the purchase. Sound quality is beyond expectations and the pairing with my Galaxy S10 is flawless. If the mic was more functional for phone conversations this would for sure be a 5 star review. The mic is definitely the weak point. The mic is functional as long as you're in a quiet space - just don't rely on it and don't buy these if your use case is mostly phone calls.

I use these to play music during my commute to and from work - the noise cancellation and sound quality make them perfect for that function. They're comfortable and provide a more than serviceable musical depth.

author: Brandon
title: Horrible Experience
content: I was sent a malfunctioning pair of earbuds, they not only had connection issues, but the quality was horrible. It sounded like they were dipped in water before sending. The high end was tingy and there was no bass. I contacted Samsung, they told me to contact Amazon and request a new pair, I contacted Amazon and Amazon contacted me back to Samsung, where Samsung told me to send them the pair for repair, I sent it to them only to get them back exactly the same that I had it. This is the worst experience I have had with Samsung (and Samsung is typically good) and Amazon.

author: KalvinStein
title: Not perfect, but seems to hit the marks in all the right places.
content:
I have been searching for so long...

I had airpods before, loved them. However I found they were really easy to lose, which is exactly what happened. I lost them. Or maybe someone stole them? I'll never know.

So now I wanted new wireless headphones, but I didn't want to shell out over 150+ dollars just for some headphones. I admit the airpods are great, but are they worth over 150 dollars of my hard earned money for some wireless capabilities? I didn't think so.

So I tried the 30-50 dollar headphones, some were a hit or miss but most of them were a miss. If they had good sound quality, they had bad bluetooth connection. If they had good bluetooth connection, they had poor sound. You get where I am going with this.

So I decided to shell out a little bit more, and get the galaxy buds. This was the sweet spot that I was looking for.

The Pros:
-the sound quality is good-also in the app you can change the type of preset sound you want, such as soft, bass boosted, dynamic, higher treble, etc.
-they last a good while. The case charges them and they work seamlessly when you put them on and off. just like the airpods
-has wireless charging
-they are nicer looking than the airpods (in my opinion, because there's no awkward rod sticking out. Some people don't have the right ears for it and it looks really silly)
-and can fit ANY ear unlike the airpods
-they have noise cancellation. I turned it on and off with the app to see if it was true and it does have ACTUAL noise cancellation.
-decent price
-good touch commands(but this also can be a con)

Cons
-the commands arent really configurable or advanced. There's no swipe for volume or anything and you can only customize the long hold. The single, double and triple tap commands are locked in. Not a deal breaker but something to understand.
-build quality, although more expensive than the cheaper china-brand ones, seemed similar. There was not much glossy finish to make it look sexy(again not a deal breaker)

for those who want to just say they have the airpods for stature or want to show off to people, I'd say stick with the airpods. The airpods still I believe are the best tiny buds, in terms of SOUND QUALITY for music. However these buds are for those who want functionality, with practicality, at a reasonable price. I said the airpods didnt seem like they were worth the 150+ dollars spent. Galaxy buds however, are they worth the 100 dollars?...I'd say a solid yes

author: Jason Arias
title: Airpod killer!
content:
Amazing headphones and definitely an apple airpod killer! They are comfortable and I didn't have to change the tips or wings because out of the box it was perfect!

Like every new product there will be some issues. I have seen some issues with music cutting out here or thier for a slight second and it fixes it self. Samsung did just update them today which seems to have fixed Bluetooth issues but just know Samsung is working on fixing any issues we have with these.

This does feature ambient sound which is an awesome feature that just lacks a bit. I feel after a few updates this will be amazing and one of the best features!

Call quality on these have been good but have noticed slight cutting out every once in a while but could be due to service and we're I'm located. The people on the other end can hear me perfectly in door and out so that's always good.

Overall I would highly suggest getting them if you have Samsung or not because of the price and the awesome features it has already built in. Feel free to ask any questions and I'll be happy to respond!

author: emailmebackat
title: What I like about Earbuds and needed improvements!
content: Try all the Eartips for the best sound and seal (Beside seal, Earbuds block most Passive Noise at medium to high volume). These earbuds seal in your ear very well. Try all the Wingtips for a secure fit. After 1st trying the Earbuds, sound so in my ears was overwhelming, after fitting the Eartips and using them for a couple of days, felt a ton better. I like how it says msgs for msgs and whose calling. I want to see these improvements. A Multi-Function Button (To answer/hang up calls, access Alexa, Google, or Siri etc.), 12hrs. Earbuds battery life w/ 4 recharges in case.

author: Zay's2cents
title: Terrible Call Quality
content:
Great Price and fits snug in ears without it being too bulky. Good sound for music and movies. Ambient noise option is good, could be better. I liked that I can wear just one ear piece without having to adjust any settings. Great for running and hiking.

Cons:
Biggest issue is the call quality. The main reason to have the bluetooth is to make calls while keeping my hands free to multitask BUT almost every call the other person says there is too much noise.  They cannot hear me clearly. Some have said it sounds extremely windy or like I'm under water. It is very frustrating wish this problem could be fixed through a software update.

author: Topher T.
title: Very good product
content:
These are so good.
Good audio, battery life, and range.

author: G. Sager
title: A "must have" for Samsung Smartphones
content: After reading the reviews of this product, I  honestly don't think a lot of people understand the difference between wireless earbuds and full over-ear wireless cans. Huge difference. Having said that, these wireless buds are a "best of breed" product. I have a Samsung S10 and these pair perfectly with that phone. The app is great. Very easy to set up and use. They are extremely comfortable and can be worn for extended periods of listening. The sound quality is really, very good. I listen to a variety of music - admittedly not hip hop, and the depth of these buds is excellent. Bass is good - not thumping. Mids are spot on and the highs are clear without being shrill or tinny. Volume is loud. The maximum level will not make your ears bleed, but it's plenty loud. Noise cancelling is good - not great, but good is still "good". They do not compare to high end, over-ear head phones. They cost way less than high end head phones. So my verdict is; this is a great earbud for the price and a "must have" if you own one of the new Samsung smartphones.

author: William Iaconis
title: The Perfect Fit
content: I've been using bluetooth ear buds for over 5 years. I have shelled out collectively close to $1,000 and tried all the major brands. While my overall experience has been pretty positive, my individual experience with each has been a combination of highs and lows. That is until I tried the Samsung Galaxy Buds. On paper, the features for these things looked pretty amazing - 6 hour playtime with an additional 7 hours stored in the case, wireless charging, automatic pairing when the case is opened, touch controls, I mean, what's not to like? Then I actually put them in my ears and started my workout. This was going to be the real test. When using earbuds, the single most important feature is the fit, because if the bud doesn't conform to your ear properly and create a tight seal, the sound will be washed and the base nonexistent. The way the buds came out of the package did not form that seal for me, but the additional tips and ear stabilizers gave me more options. After switching out the stock setup, I was pleased to find that I was able to achieve that seal, and let me tell you, the sound is impressive. I'm fairly certain the base was the best I've experienced of any buds I've owned. As far as my workout went, the Galaxy Buds didn't move a millimeter. Not when I was rowing, not when I was deadlifting, and not when I was slamming battle ropes. I can't honestly say I've successfully put any other bud through my workout routine without getting at least some movement, which ultimately broke the seal and ruined the sound. I think the Galaxy Buds passed this test for two reasons. First, the stabilizers keep the outer part of the bud firmly in place, and don't allow any space for them to move. Second, the bud itself is almost flush with the ear, so there isn't much projecting outward to create the leverage needed for wobble. Another awesome feature is the ambient sound option. When ambient sound is turned on, you can actually hear the outside world in addition to your music. It's actually quite mind boggling when you use it. I'm assuming it uses the mic that picks up your voice during phone calls to receive external sound and pipe it through the buds with your music. I'm so happy with the performance of the Samsung Galaxy Buds that I keep an additional pair charged in my car to wear when I work.

author: Leon
title: Objective vs Subjective
content:
Let me start with; I was an Apple fan for over a decade. I've owned everything from iPods, to Apple Watches to the iPhone X. I still think they are great products. However, I switched to Samsung about 6 months ago. Why? Well, I don't want to paint myself into any corners and with the ease of trading in phones I figured I'd give Samsung a try in case I was missing anything.

Boy, was I missing things. IMO, Samsung is just far easier to set up. Samsung has more apps and abilities for me personally. Samsung is just overall better in nearly all facets of this game.

Now, on to these ear buds. In summary...I love them. They are as close to perfect as anything you'll ever buy under $200. (I paid $129). The fit is great. The sound quality is fantastic. I don't consider myself a sound snob, but these are clear and loud. I have seen some reviews complaining about the loudness, but I think these people didn't realize that you can adjust the loudness settings via the app. And how great is it that as soon as I opened up the case they found and paired with my Samsung Galaxy Note 9? How great was it that I was able to open my laptop and see that my ear buds were an option without having to do anything? I mow the lawn with these. I work out with these. I sit at my desk and listen to music while at work with these. If you're considering these or the Jabra's or Apple Earpods...just get the Samsung. You won't regret it.

author: Alyssia L
title: Great But... The Battery Life Is Problematic
content: I love the ear buds. They're good quality, good noise blocking, and super comfortable in my ears with lots of customizable features... but unfortunately after only about a month, the right bud has an issue with the battery draining to nothing while the left remains at 100%. The charging case itself also has some power issues and constantly needs plugged in or placed on a charging pad because it can't produce its own charging power to the buds. Regardless, I could have it plugged in for hours and the right bud won't get above 50% while the left is full. Customer service just wants to pass my problem around from representative to representative without even knowing what to do to fix it. Great product save the battery issue... I assume they've worked on it with the newer models but regardless, buying through Amazon has been less than ideal as Samsung would have honored the replacement warranty without question or handing off my concern to the next person if I had ordered through fire directly. After only a little over a single month I'm less than impressed.

author: maikel m.
title: Highly recommend
content: Sound is amazing when using the app, compatibility is the phenomenal, had some issues with cutitng out occasionally but not that often, range is about 33 feet, very easy to use, touch controls are responsive and easy to use, also had an issue with compatibility with spoitfy occasionally but I think it's a software problem with my phone and the drivers for the buds. Best ones I've gotten so far, better than the jabra elete  active. I'd recommend these to anyone who is looking for amazing sound and ling battery life, these last the advertised 6 hours easily.

author: An onymous
title: Do Not Recommend
content:
When used for phone calls, the sound quality for the other party is so horrible that they ask me to not use the earbuds when on a phone call with them.
The earbuds also lack the software codec necessary for low latency when used for the audio when watching shows on a smart television, which means the dialogue does not match with the actors' mouth movements.

author: Kyle
title: So far, these are incredible. Well done Samnsung.
content:
EDIT: I am giving these an updated 4 star review. It happens randomly, but the Bluetooth connection gets choppy when only a couple feet away from the Buds. If I have my phone in my pocket and bend over or reach to grab something, the connection cuts in and out at random times. It has only happened a handful of times. So we'll see if it becomes a constant problem. The battery life is solid, however. I used them for 3 hours and still had 40% battery. I still stand by my initial review. They are great, but maybe need a couple bugs worked out still.

These things are amazing. I had purchased a $70 no name brand Bluetooth Airpod look alike. They were cheap garbage. They constantly lost signal and had terrible sound quality. They also didn't fit my ear and fell out multiple times. So I decided to drop the money on the Galaxy Buds. They have been well worth the money, at least so far. The difference is almost uncomparable. They came with the medium ear tip and wingtip installed. The Buds fit my ears perfectly right out of the box. The sound quality is insane and the connection is strong, with no loss of signal at all**see edit.

The ambient noise reduction is pretty damn impressive. The option to either turn on the ambient sound filter permanently or temporarily by holding the Bud is extremely useful. I have been using the Dynamic equalizer setting and have found it hard to hear certain sounds without the ambient sound option enabled. So I suggest experimenting with what sounds good to you so you don't have any safety issues. These things really do block a lot of sound.

They are incredibly easy to connect to a Galaxy device. Make sure to download the Galaxy Wearable app beforehand to make connecting even faster. After connecting and charging, I used them for over an hour straight and the battery was still at 90%. I will update on battery life in detail after more use. Overall, I am extremely happy with the purchase. If you are looking for new headphones and have the funds, I say buy a pair. I plan to update my review if anything drastic or alarming happens. But so far, I highly recommend the Galaxy Buds.

author: Moose
title: Exactly what I was looking for
content:
TL,DR;
-Fit my tiny ears, comfortably
-Can be used together or independently
-Happy I've spent the money for the quality

I have gotten some cheap earbuds over the years, bought a different set and returned them the next day due to not fitting at all just before getting these. Granted the tech has improved as a function of time. These are worth every dollar so far.
I have small ears, finding buds that will fit is very hard (even using the smallest options). These are the most comfortable and secure I've ever tried.
Being able to use each bud independent of the other was a huge factor in deciding on these over the more expensive ones I was eyeing. I'm still getting used to the touch aspect, I like it though. You don't need to mash them into your ear to get the button to engage. The set-up was super easy and I like that there's an app for further control/customization.
It's a bit disappointing that the case dosn't have a bigger battery for more charges. That's a small gripe though since I tend to only use one at a time.
These aren't for hard audiophiles, from what I've seen so far. If that's a deal-breaker; go drop on some corded-over ear monitors.
So happy I took the plunge on these.

author: Thomas
title: Decent, not great.
content:
Sound quality is as good as the wired headphones that come with the S10. I throw it on a wireless charging pad once a week and have never had an issue with running out of power.

My issues with the headphones are the ambient sound performance and connectivity performance.

The ambient sound passthrough is not effective enough to make a difference. I was hoping to be able to wear these and be aware if someone was trying to get my attention, but they dont even pick up the ringing of my phone.

The other issue is a little more serious and that is the connection will sometime drop out of one of the buds. I have to remove the bud, place in the case and then try again. Its 50/50 on whether or not it works.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Earbuds connected independently, not as 1
content: I could not get these to work.  I spent all afternoon on the phone with Samsung support and then another hour with Amazon. My earbuds were each registering with my bluetooth as different devices.  They were obviously different versions of firmware because when I connected the app with 1 of the earbuds, it said I needed to upgrade my software for the device. But it wouldn't let me unless both earbuds were connected.  The other one didn't require the upgrade. I made sure my S10 had all the current software. I uninstalled the app, removed the earbuds each one from my bluetooth, rebooted my phone so many times that I could do it in my sleep. I googled this issue and it seems this is a big problem.  Reddit also has a long discussion about this issue.  I liked the size and the look of these. But unfortunately they had to be returned. They were useless.

author: Mark Yochum
title: Great earbuds, the best I've owned
content: Coolest earbuds I've ever had. I'm going to be honest, the bass isn't what you'd imagine, it's more of a clean and solid punch. The audio is very clear, haven't tried calling anyone with them yet, but I've heard nothing but good things about it. Bixby is available. I recommend using them with Dolby Atmos turned on, it improves the quality and volume even more. Keep the setting on dynamic mode. The sound isn't overwhelming like some, they fit comfortably and will not fall out of your ears. The touch gestures were hard to get used to at first for me because I couldn't touch them directly, but once you learn where they're at it gets easier. Overall, I love these, they are extremely cool, have great sound quality, and allow you to be more hands free. Very reasonable pricing, and in my opinion, they are definitely worth the money.

author: Ben
title: Fantastic Earbuds! They Wont Fall Out!
content:
These are my first pair of wireless ear buds! I am pretty surprised and impressed by the quality of them in each category.

I dont have much luck with ear buds staying in my ear. Especially the Apple earbuds. However, these are some of the first that I am not having to be pushing back into my ear at all. In addition to having the in-ear tips, they also have soft, comfortable fins on the top that locks the bud into your ear. While I can feel the earbuds themselves in my ear, this upper locking "fin" is not intrusive at all.

Sound quality is great! Bass is rather deep and everything seems balanced. Because they are in ear, they have some pretty great natural noise cancelation. I feel pretty immersed whenever I'm listening. They also have this ambient sound feature that can be toggled on and off. It allows the listener to let certain sounds through so that you can hear your surroundings and not be totally isolated.

Charge time is fast. The case they come in is sleek looking. And it has wireless power share from a Samsung device.

The bluetooth tether distance is pretty far too. Ive left my phone in the back yard and walked into the house and was still able to listen! In general, the bluetooth has never dropped on me.

My only piece of criticism is when using the touch pads, on the buds, when they are in my ear. Tapping on them is akin to tapping on a drum. It's not the worst thing in the world, but something to note.

I cant imagine how the new Apple earbud Pros would be better than this. They have many of the same features such as noise passthrough and the Samsung buds are $150 cheaper. That alone makes these the winner.

author: Cory H.
title: They cut out more than I think they should.
content:
Was super excited to finally get some truly wireless earbuds. Wanted so much to like these. For the most part I do, with one overwhelming negative... they cutout. The more I use them the more I notice they cut out. Phone in your pocket and you lean over, cut out. Turn your head, cut out. Hand against your head, cut out. Any activity, except sitting at a desk, you can expect them to cut out. 83.5% of the time they stay connected, but that 16.5% drives me crazy. Maybe I'm expecting too much, maybe bluetooth technology isn't capable of meeting my expectations. I've tried every suggestion to improve this issue with no success. Have requested a replacement pair in hope that I got a bad set so will update review if those work out
Pro:
Great fit
Comfortable
Sound good
Look good
Wireless charge

Con:
Cut out
Want more volume (I can hear them over my mower, I just want the option to crank it to 11)
Lag with games ( not a deal breaker for me but know they lag if you're looking for that)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Just my opinions ( I love them so far )
content:
The quality of the material used to make these buds is good. Yes it's plastic but it's nicely and professionally put together. Very light weight and comfortable to wear. Mine fit almost perfectly into my ears straight out of the box.
The sound quality actually was a pleasant surprise. I really wasn't expecting much from it sound quality wise, the actually sounded pretty good. I find that higher volumes is where seem to get the punchiness of the bass. Mids and top ends r clear (not the crispiest but crispy). So overall the sound quality was good enough for an over good experince. I must also add that i found them to provide good seal from out side noises ( i like that)

For me personally battery life was good

author: glorial386
title: Love It
content: First off, the packaging and charging/carrying case is sleek and compact, to set up on my Samsung Galaxy S8+ it took about 30secs. The earpieces were a snug seal that even when I jumped up and down, never even move to come out. That seal also helps with the sound quality a lot. I did have to tweak the settings on the Buds app on my phone to find the right balance of sound. The sound it'self is great. The balanced sound had clear vocals and solid bass, I like the concept that you can maintain awareness of your surroundings. I tested it out while listening to TV, for example, you can hear the difference. I also like that I can answer calls I tested by making a few business calls to my client's offices and they seemed to have no problem hearing me. I could hear them clearly Overall, I am very happy and excited to use these! I LOVE being totally wire-free and the convenience and comfort of these. I do recommend these and I also would recommend as a user take a few extra minutes to adjust the right size and sound settings before making any final decisions or totally writing these off. I am overjoyed with these!!!

author: David
title: Performs well, not perfect
content:
I really like these ear buds. I have never had something I bought instantly become a part of my "daily carry items". I never leave home without these things. They are so easy to pair to my phone, by the time the earbud is in my ear, it's connected to my phone and I can talk on the phone or listen to music.

I will say that sometimes there is issue with the connection quality if the phone is in your pocket, but given how darn awesome these things are, that's not an issue for me.  Sound quality is good all things considered, but I'm no audiophile so I would understand if some people might be disappointed. I also thing the noise cancelling is good considering is passive cancelling. Battery life hasn't been an issue.

My only complaint is that I usually can't wear these for more than an hour or so at a time. Any longer than that and they hurt my ear.

author: Dudtal
title: They are not compatible w iPhone and PC’s
content:
Update: I believe the Pc compatibility issue derived from the fact I am using Windows 10. According to what I have been able to find you would have to be using Windows 8 or an earlier version to have compatibility with the Galaxy Ear Buds via your PC Bluetooth connection.

Let’s start with the fact there is no compatibility to a PC via Bluetooth. Regardless if your PC is Bluetooth ready, these may may not pair. They didn’t work with my brand new Dell Latitude 5290 running Windows 10. Hence, if you travel with a laptop or use it to listen to music while working you may be plain out of luck.
Second issue is if you want to use these with an IPhone you may want to reconsider this. I did get sound from them and they did pair. However, there is no supporting app I’m in the apple App Store which means you can’t update firmware unless you go to a store and have them do it. That was Samsung’s work around for this issue. Also all you can do is listen and talk without any of the so called features.

author: ftariq
title: worst experience with PC
content:
bought with high expectations three months back. Previously i have another one only 16$ worth online shopping that was much better than these expensive ones.
Pros: Brand name
smart case
Cons:
Limited battery life, average sound quality
I have to connect to my PC in my office EVER DAY. It take almost 30 minutes every morning to install and re-install. No matter what ever I tried to avoid this hassle.
phone connection is relatively straight forward.

author: MikeInWeston
title: Nowhere near Bose, slightly above average sound.
content:
I am disappointed because I've had several pair of these true-wireless earbuds and was expecting Bose from these.

Some of the sound difference may be due to fit but I've tried. I have a $30 pair that sound no worse.

Other features are a little better than average. I bought these for ease of use for phone calls,  and the touchpad is the best feature. I didn't like the way airpods look like cigarettes or cotton medical devices, and was hoping matching a Samsung wearable with a Samsung phone would have some positive benefits but the app is another disappointment.

I'm keeping these for the touchpad abs hoping that they are of high quality, but suggest you consider other options.

author: J Mags
title: Great for music horrible if you want to be heard on calls
content:
The sound quality is fantastic for listening to music. Customization options with Samsung Galaxy devices really helps.
The Ambient Sound feature is handy if you wear them around the office. For the music listening, I gave a 2nd star otherwise they would've gotten my lowest rating possible.
Here's the thing, nobody can hear you when you talk to them on the phone through the G Buds. Every single person has had the same problem hearing me as very muffled &/or with chirps or clicks that drown out my voice.
As they're made to work with my phone, they're almost useless for the purpose for which I bought them.

author: dah_lutz
title: Great choice, especially for galaxy owners
content: I purchased these and the jlab air buds. After a few hours of comparisons and a full workout in each, I am sticking with the galaxy buds. The sound quality is better, more clarity and depth, but a little less bass. The ambient noise feature is unique, but nice and I'll have to play around with it. These were much more comfortable for longer wear than the jlabs. Both stayed in place well, but these do not stick out as much. That made them feel more secure and I touched them less. The touch pad is intuitive, but sensitive. I stopped my music a few times on accident. I pair these with a galaxy s8, and the galaxy wear app provides additional controls and EQ settings that are nice. Glad I spent a little extra to try them. However, the jlab air buds are a quality product, especially if you don't own a Samsung phone. Attached photos show relative size difference between the galaxy buds and jlab air buds. Galaxy has smaller bud and smaller case and wireless charging.

author: Ronald Stockwell
title: Great design, poor performance
content:
I've had these now for about a week.  Here's the pros and cons.
 - Great fit.  They fit nice and snug and don't feel at all like they want to come loose.  I've had many other nice (wired) earbuds, and some that come with different ear hole cups.  None have been large enough to fit snug.  The large size cups and rings on the Galaxy buds fit perfect.
- Sound quality is good.  Not great, but good.
- The charging case is nice and works well.
- Battery life seems good.
- Bluetooth performance is poor, and I'm talking about range, not sound.  I have an S9, and this phone works great with my gear wearable and my car stereo via bluetooth.  I normally have my phone in my back pocket, and the buds do not work well at all with it there.  In my front pocket its better, but if I turn my torso at all in either direction, the sound cuts out and gets choppy right away.  These two factors alone are enough for me to wish I hadn't spent the money on these.  I should have waited another year for version 2.  The phone simply needs to be too close to the buds for them to work well.

author: Henry
title: Not for an audiophile
content: They are a great idea, and they pair easily with my Galaxy Note 8. Battery life is fantastic and the little base provides extra charging. Fairly comfortable, stay in the ear ok, but they do start to feel heavy after an hour or so. But the sound quality leaves much to be desired. Not bad for rock/pop and working out at the gym, but classical and jazz sounds terrible. Very little bass even w/ the equalizer settings maximizing the bottom. I much prefer the sound quality of my Bose (wired) noice canceling in-ear phones. On the plus side, taking a phone call in them is pretty cool; they sound very clear and capture my voice amazingly well, considering there is no mouthpiece. Overall, a solid 3 stars.

author: B. Cole
title: Works better on iPhone than on Galaxy
content:
I want to start out by saying I really like the overall physical design of these headphones.  They are really nice feeling and ergonomic in a way that my old AirPods just never were.  Also the sound quality is top notch when it comes to music or spoken-word audio.  The noice cancelling aspect works great which can be easily overridden with a feature that allows you to hear ambient sounds (a feature only usable on Android devices, unfortunately).

I purchased these as AirPod replacements.  I wanted something with some proper water resistance and good audio quality.  My AirPods had slipped out of my hands one day and fell right into a puddle.  They still work but at a significantly reduced sound quality.  After reading reviews on several different kinds of wireless earbuds, I eventually settled on these as a replacement set.  They worked very well on my iPhone, however a major downside to using these with an iOS device is you don't have access to the "Galaxy Wearable" App which allows you to adjust settings or use the ambient sound feature.  This doesn't make a lot of sense since there already is a Galaxy Watch app for iOS which allows you to use Samsung Galaxy watches on iPhone.  I feel like this App should be ported over, it could only mean more sales for Samsung if they did.  As they are now, for the basics of listening to music or other audio, making phone calls or talking to Siri, they work great.

Then I had another water-related mishap with my iPhone and I was forced to revert back to my old Samsung Galaxy S6.  On the S6 I've had a very mixed experience.  I can now use the App and now have a more feature-rich experience.  The different options inside the Wearable app are pretty neat and contain a lot more detail than what you could achieve with the AirPods running natively on iPhone.  However, one gigantic flaw that I experienced to a limited degree on iPhone began to become insurmountable on the Galaxy: the bluetooth connection.  These headphones have the most strange relationship with their connected device once you go outside.  If I understood better the different radio frequencies at play with WiFi and Bluetooth maybe I could go into detail about what must be going on here, but near as I can tell anytime you reach the edge of any given WiFi range, the signal between the phone and the headphones begins to distort.  So if you want to use your headphones to listen to music or something while jogging in the neighborhood, they are functionally useless since you are always in this dead-zone and distortion occurs.  The sound crackles and skips or just goes silent.  The audio is still playing on the device and once you get back in a distortion-free area you can hear it again, not paused or anything but having advanced normally as if you could hear the whole time.  There are some strange workarounds.  If I take the phone out of my pocket and hold it close to my head, the issue does not occur.  If I take my phone out and place it on a table outside, that also seems to work and I can hear fine while I stay within the normal Bluetooth range from the phone.

No, I am not streaming audio over Wifi, this happens regardless of whether the audio I'm listening to has been downloaded to the device or is being streamed.  I can turn WiFi off on my phone and it'll still happen.  Indoors I have almost never experienced this nor have I had it happen in my car.  It only seems to happen out of doors vaguely near buildings.  If I'm away from any buildings its fine.  This is why I am attributing it to a conflict between the WiFi signal and the bluetooth signal.  I don't have this issue with my AirPods or any other wireless headphones I've used over the years.  This is a massive pain and severely reduces their usability.  As such, they are very difficult to recommend.  If they can fix this with a future firmware update (which seems like something they should be able to do), then I can rate these higher.  The issue isn't as pronounced on iPhone.  However, without the app, there is no option to get updates and as such any issues you have will never get fixed.

EDIT 10/4/19: Several updates have come out since posting this and there have been some slight changes.  It seems like the problems I was having with distortion while out-of-doors have slightly improved.  The nature of the distortion has changed from an analog distortion sound to a digital distortion sound if that makes a any sense at all.  It distorts a little, little less than before, but it's almost unchanged.  They are still almost completely useless if you carry your phone in your pants pocket outside.  If you want to use them outside, you'll need to put your phone in a shirt pocket, hold it in your hand out at an angle, carry it in a purse so long as the bag doesn't hang below your hips, or use one of those armbands that were a thing back when people went jogging with their iPods.  I am a living/breathing sunk-cost fallacy so I will continue to use these headphones for at least another year to justify the cost, then I'm just hoping that whatever Apple is planning with their next release of the AirPods will include waterproofing and better audio.

author: amazonme
title: I wanted to love these but the negatives far surpass the positives
content:
I SO wanted to love these Galaxy Buds. Unfortunately,  negatives far surpass the positives.

PROS:
Design - I love the design. They fit completely in the ear without any "extras" dangling down like the Airpods
Fit - Extremely comfortable & stayed in my ears during my run without any problem. I have small ear canals & ear buds often hurt my ears. These did not bother me at all even after a few hours of wear.
iPhone Connection - It was easy to connect the Galaxy Buds to my iPhone by selecting them in my iPhone's Blue Tooth settings
Charging Case - case is compact, sleek & easy to operate

CONS:
Sound Quality - If you're a sound connoisseur these are definitely not for you. I bought these solely for running & to replace my Plantronics Backbeat Fit 300. The sound quality of the Galaxy Buds was notably inferior to the BB Fit. I was willing to compromise on sound for complete wireless convenience, but...
Noise Canceling - Non-existent. So much ambient noise bleeds through it's unbelievable. I wore these in the airport & could barely hear the music playing on my iPhone despite having the volume turned up quite loud.
Connection Issues - As I mentioned above, I bought the Galaxy Buds primarily for running.  I took the Galaxy Buds on my first run & paired them to my Apple Watch. The entire 3.5 mile run the Galaxy Buds snapped, crackled & popped. I can only guess they were having trouble staying connected to my Apple Watch which was on my wrist no more than 2 feet away at any time. I never had this issue with the Plantronics Backbeat Fit ear buds. For me, this was the deal breaker.
