By the time I finished my first mile I wanted to tear the Galaxy Buds from my ears & throw them in a ditch. The constant popping was unbearable. I turned the music volume up which helped to mask some of the crackling sound & was grateful I had only gone out for a short run.

Sadly, I'll be returning these little guys.

author: aliya23
title: the best bluetooth headphones
content: I love these bluetooth headphones! I use them everyday when I'm on the phone for long periods of time. I love AKG headphones because of the fit and the sound quality; for me nothing beats them, so it's great they are used for these bluetooth headphones. What's also great is that I can use my galaxy s9 plus charger to charge these; that's what comes in the packaging, a small galaxy s9 charger. So now I have two, which is a wonderful bonus. And they come with multiple ear buds so you can see which fits your ear the best. The only con to these bluetooth headphones is that I wish they did fit my ears better because they do loosen easily and fall out at times.

author: Edmund A
title: AKG is quality. Period.
content:
I have high end headphones and IEMS (Sennheiser, Beyerdynamic, AKG, Mrspeakers, etc.) but I wanted something small and unobtrusive for exercising.

 Because of the reviews (which so often just are repetitions without real personal discernment) I was expecting great comfort/practicality and bad sound. I remember thinking: “why AKG would put a bad driver here when even their cheaper headphones are so good for the price? Why Samsung, using bluetooth 5.0, wouldn’t put a decent sound?"

 Well, either some reviewers (I mean Youtubers and web reviewers) are deaf, or the latest software update changed radically this TWE, because the sound is good! (as usual, just finding a good seal with the correct eartip size).

 This is a pleasant surprise, it exceeded my expectations and reminded me that “reviewers” often just convince themselves and others with preconceived notions. Give this a try and decide by yourself.

author: Matthew
title: Almost entirely replaced my wired headphones which I love.
content:
I'm a person prone to youtube binges and music marathons while staring blankly at my ceiling so the concept of wireless buds seemed like a dream. I'm not an active person outside of my work, which requires that I be able to hear, so my use for them is simply the convenience of walking into the more populated areas of my house without disturbing people when I do venture into the abyss that is social situations.

Battery life: I'm just going to get this one out of the way. I think after we all did the 3 hours of research comparing the top dogs of true wireless earbuds, we threw the idea of going days untethered from charging wires out the window with these.  No one is expecting exceptional battery life from these and neither was I.
 I can say that the buds alone seem to have the will to go well into what I'd consider lengthy use sessions of around 4-6 hours of YouTube and less on the music end.  The sacrifice to the technology gods we make when buying these though, is the case. This case is weak sauce, sometimes holding what I'd consider to barely even be a full charge for them. It does make up for it with it's hysterically compact design. Lil pill boi.

Sound quality: I've owned apple airBUDS (not pods), samsung akg headphones, onemore triple drivers, and currently own onemore quad drivers. I'm an audiophile who knows nothing about sound but i'm not so primitive as to not be able to differentiate between to experiences. These compare most closely to wired triple drivers in the hierarchy of sound quality. I was pleasantly surprised with the highs and base of these guys. They aren't top of the line but they pack a punch that goes well beyond any out of the box wired headphones that come with a phone.  I'm not kidding.  For convenience sake, I rarely use my quad drivers anymore.

Functionality: The bluetooth is flawless in timing and instantly connects to your phone. The range is average. At about 30ft and between multiple walls and one story above me they started to lose connection. The touchpad is annoying as it seems to go off with a brush of the arm if I'm not trying to touch them but as soon as I want to pause I need to give it multiple taps sometimes. That's not going to be used again.  The ambient noise is noticable but not usable due to it being really selective with what it lets through.

I can definitely say they're 100% worth the money for me and I won't be on the market until they break.

author: cheetoresidue
title: Beats air pods for sure
content: I bought a black pair for my wife and a white pair for my self. I also have the first generation air pods. Comparing the two, Samsungs galaxy buds are better in every way. Especially design, the secure fit by far the best feature. I swear I fell like I am in a special ops unit when I where these. I am satisfied with the fit compared to air pods. The only down side that I didn't realize is the white ones look like hearing aids when they are worn. The black ones look far better in the ear. Like a cool fashion accessory. As far as the sound they are better sounding compared to the air pods. Only due to the fact that they are designed far better. Meaning they are actually sealed in your ear canal. I love the extensive engineering put into these little things.

author: J. Paul
title: Brilliant design!  Amazing sound and easy to use/maintain in variety of activities/ conditions.
content: Samsung hit a home run with these buds. Great snug yet comfortable fit and don't fall out after months of use in a variety of activities and exercise. Great noise cancelling for buds when mowing grass and on airplane. Not complete noise cancellation, but close when playing music. Exceptional crisp sound, best I have heard on any buds. Would be nice to have a little more bass, but better than any buds I have tried, probably need larger headset to get more bass. Love auto play music option when place in ears. Never need to turn on or off, automatically turns on when place in ear and off when place in case. Very innovative case, easy to open yet firmly closes to keep from accidentally opening. Wireless charging in small case minimizes burden of charging and gradual green/yellow/red light helps warn battery level to avoid surprise loss of battery power.  Samsung deserves some type of tech award, these buds are brilliantly designed and worth the price. Highly recommended!

author: DCityy
title: These Buds are everything 🐐
content: I've only had these a couple days but they are the best. They fit perfectly, I've never had a wireless bud fit so good. The sound quality is great and so is the battery life. Everybody should have a pair of these

author: devin
title: They hit a home run
content: These are pretty much perfect. The setup was more involved than a simple pair of bluetooth headphones, however it is understandable considering the features and tech that is packed into them. They are linked to the Galaxy Wearable app which controls different features including noise cancelling, the touchpad buttons, the equalizer, and the find my earbuds feature. They fit in my ear very well and come with adjustable ear insert thingies to fit different ear shapes/sizes. They case/box they come in also double as a charger which can charge wirelessly. I have been vigilant of other wireless earbud wearers and these seem to be fairly low profile in comparison. The sound quality is pretty good. Good highs, ok lows, and a dynamic mode on the equalizer that is a good balance of sound. I thought the sound quality would be just a little better but still great for the price. The battery life seems great, no complaints. Overall I think they are a fantastic value.

author: William
title: Superb Wireless Earbuds, Particularly For The Price
content: Samsung knocked it out of the park with these. The sound quality and battery life is excellent compared to the obvious competitor (Airpods). A small, sleek case that fits easily in your pocket and allows wireless charging. Great noise cancellation by default, because they form a seal in your ear, which further improves the overall sound quality vs. the open style of Airpods, particularly in the bass department. The rubber stabilizers on these buds "lock" into your ear and stay in easily when exercising. Comfortable for long periods of use. Simple and effective touch controls. Overall, I couldn't ask for better.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Ear buds!
content: I bought these for use in school, and just on the go. The sleek and small design makes them perfect for public use, and they cancel noise very well. I found myself using the microphones to listen to the people around me so I could hear when they were attempting to get my attention. The sound quality is good! It's not the best, but it certainly didn't leave me disappointed. The battery life also never got in my way. The case always kept my earbuds charged and ready to go. Rarely did I ever struggle with the case dying. Overall these are well worth the money and a great choice. (Used on Samsung Galaxy Note 9)

author: J. G.
title: Voice transmission is terrible
content:
UPDATE:  Now EVERY call I'm on the other callers complain of terrible sound quality until I switch to something other than these earbuds.  After switching to just the phone or wired earbuds, no issues.  If I could give these zero stars I would.  And of course it is too late to return them.  Don't waste your money.

I was excited to get these, but after almost 2 months of use I'm going to have to go back to my wired ear buds.  I can hear callers clearly, but they do not transmit my voice well at all.  Callers complain of "scratchy" and muted audio when my voice comes through to them to the point that I have to quit using them on calls.

author: mgenova79
title: In call quality is horrible
content: The sound quality for media playback is great, and the pairing process is a breeze.  That being said the quality of sound in phone calls is just absolutely horrible.  It also will not pair to multiple devices.  I carry a work phone and a personal phone and this feature of connecting to multiple devices is important to me.  I returned them after one day.  I'll be using my jaybird x3 headset until I find a better truly wireless headset

author: Brandon Foster
title: Great for high activity
content:
You can do anything with these in and once you have the wing tips on they NEVER come out. It's also good for work environments since you can use one at a time and once the battery on one gets low just put tmit in the case to charge and use the other, though if you want to use both it still has good battery life I'll say about 3-4 hrs if you like to blas your music. If you have small ears like me it'll still fit if you have big ears they'll fit like a glove. They also dont take that long to charge and the case doesn't take long to charge either.

Sound quality is good for earbuds that are 100% wireless.

I'll recommend these over earpods because they come with wing tips and the airpods doesn't.

Once paired with your device all you have to do to connect is turn on your Bluetooth and open the case.

The touch pad is pretty responsive.

If you watch videos on YouTube at x1.75 or x2 speed like myself I won't recommend it there's a huge delay, watching at normal speed is good though.
Carrying case is small enough to fit in almost any pocket and yes it'll fit in those tight pants you females love so much.

author: Daikel Alvarez Darías
title: No cargan ya a las 2 semanas de haberlos comprado
content: No llevo ni un mes con ellos y ya se rompieron uno de los dos no carga y aparte se escullaba un ruido en las llamadas son de vaja calidad me decepciono samsumg

author: Craig Standefer
title: Brain cancer?
content:
Some things to note that I didn't see emphasized in other feedback before my purchase:

I didn't really expect it to be so difficult to hear people talking to me. You can turn on the ambient sound booster but it hisses. So you can't just wear them while you are in a social environment (or at the office). My solution was to wear just one.

The audio quality when playing music seems a little dull. The quality is on par with or below regular old cheapo earbuds. Perhaps I don't have them seated properly.

Sadly, one of the reasons I got these was for mobile gaming/media. Unfortunately, the latency is garbage. Audio is at least a half second delayed.

These aren't terrible or perfect, but there doesn't seem to be a useful fit for them in my life apart from hands free calling while driving. Also brain cancer?

author: Giovanni Ruiz
title: Love these
content: Love these.. fit oerfect..super secure.. no drops in connection. I must say, pairing with my galaxy note 9 was so easy, and the gear app makes the customizations I want! I found that I put Google voice as the hold sensor trigger on one bud, and then just used "hi bixby" for things I needed to do within my phone, and the buds picked it up, and Bixby launched!  Seemless work sammy! Thanks for a great product! If you dont have a Samsung, or cant get the gear app for it, your experience may be dulled...

author: Josh
title: Great in every way but...
content: Alright, I have basically 0 complaints for this product, ive used 3 other wireless earbuds and all caused some degree of pain or discomfort because of the way they either fit my ears or the way the eartips/earbud was made (the jabra 65t, tranya t2, and the treblab N8 sports). These are extremely light and comfortable regardless of how many times you take them out and put them back in your ears.  The sound is great/good. The connection is distance is great and so is the size and look in public. The only 2 issues which i experience a couple times a day is first it gets some kind of interference as if your connection breaking up even tho its in your pocket. The second is that sometimes for whatever reason there will be latency between earbuds causing you to hear the same thing but like 200ms -1s apart. With that said id gladly take these over those other earbuds that didnt have these 2 issues.

author: D. Hayes
title: Convenient, but connection could be better
content:
I bought these for use with my iPhone X because AirPods and other earbud style headphones don’t stay in my ears.

I particularly like the fit, as the in-ear design both keeps them secure and blocks out noise. They’re also very light which means you can wear them for long periods of time without worrying about discomfort. The small size means they also don’t look odd shoved in your ears like some competitors.

Sound quality is decent, but won’t blow anyone away. My biggest issue, however, is that I consistently have connection problems while walking. I can use these without issue while working out but if I use them while walking on my lunch break (in a city) I’m met with lots of dropouts and interference. I have to hold my phone above my waist for a consistent connection. Thus far I haven’t figured out what causes the interference as it doesn’t happen in other situations (gym, home, airplanes/airports, etc.)

Still, despite the issues while walking I’m generally happy with these.

EDIT: After a recent firmware update I’ve had far fewer connection issues so my biggest issue has pretty much been taken care of. I’ve adjusted my review to 4 stars as a result.

author: RII
title: Great sound
content:
At every purchase, I look for a reason to dismiss Amazon because of the fact that they have hit or miss customer service. 1. Amazon did not dissapoint on delivery.  2. The buds were a gamble. 3. After updating the software and fitting the buds, I can't complain.

At first, I was sceptical on the low range of sound, but honestly they're just good.

The mid and high are great off the rip.

Bass took boost from the wear app, but it is genuinely solid. We tried some Dr. Dre, some Clint Mansell, Halsey, Madonna, and GoT theme.

Fitted and ready, these are very nice.  They aren't going to blow out your skull, though.

My wife and I paired them almost simultaneously without hiccups and also sang together without a hitch.

The very best completely wireless headset we have experienced.

author: Dane
title: Comfortable and intuitive
content: I lost my first pair of these in an uber about three days after getting them and immediately purchased another pair, even at the $100 price point - they are by far the most comfortable wireless earbuds I've owned. They are not too big or too hard, and also feel very secure in my ears. The sound is very clear, and the controls are easy to use. I appreciate the chime sound they make when you put them in your ears.

author: K. O.
title: Decent sound, good noise isolation, good features but many Bluetooth issues.
content:
I need to mention that, whether or not it's something to do with Samsung or Amazon, regardless of that the buds arrived In an opened box, they didn't look used but the box was not factory sealed.

As far as the product itself, well, they're pretty great for what they're meant to do, especially, when you consider the fact that the Sennheiser and many other rivals cost twice as much (or more) without any real benefits because these sound amazing, the noise isolation is superb, they're comfortable and light. The battery lasts a long time and they're easy to use.
The only real issue is the fact that the Bluetooth seems to cut in and out, a lot, I tried to change the settings but it doesn't seem to have any impact on the issue. I'm going to wait for a few more days and then I'll exchange them or return them if the issue persists.

author: JMar
title: Great for the price! But....
content:
Great for the price! Sound quality is good. Material used is great. Battery life good too. Only gripe i have is after using my S10 to power share on it 1 time. It stopped charging wirelessly!! My phone charges but my buds will not wirelessly charge. I tried power sharing repeatedly with my S10 but it will not work. I can still use a cable but that defeats the purpose! I am not a cave man, so i am not going back to those flinstone times. Sending in as defective.

Update: 2nd set of ear buds now drop calls whenever they feel like it. Going to return and ask for ANOTHER pair. I am still holding onto my faith for Samsung. I hope 3rd times the charm....hopefully

Update: 3rd times the charm. Although it has dropped a call one time. I think i am just paranoid since my first two experiences.  Great quality, love the size. I could wear them at work and no one would be the wiser. Thanks Samsung! Faith restored.

author: Andrew R.
title: Update
content: Look, I am brand loyal to Samsung, I usually love their stuff. I wanted to love these buds but they suck and I don't love them at all. I returned a pair of soundcore neo's that sounded twice as good at half the price but had some connectivity issues when my galaxy s9 plus was in my pocket and I was walking or running. So I bought these Samsung Buds figuring they'd be much better, especially at more than double the price. I'm not sure whether connectivity is better because I couldn't get past the horrible tinny sound and lack of volume. I went into the Samsung Wearable app and set the volume at Max, maxed volume on my phone as well, but they're just garbage. Low volume AND horrible sound quality. And it's not just this particular set, either. I paired a set my friend has and same thing. So save your money and buy the soundcore neo's, maybe you won't have the same issues I had. Or, spend a little more and buy the Sony's like I'll be doing right now.  UPDATE. I decided give these buds buds more of a chance. I have an xl ear chamber so replaced the largest sized tips(included with buds) with a larger pair that I had from another set that still allow the buds to fit in the case and accept a charge. Doing that improved the performance of these buds dramatically. As far as volume goes I've gotten used to the max volume of these buds and find it to be quite sufficient since I now get a better seal from the larger tips. I've changed my two star rating to four, and would give them a five if Samsung included some xl size tips for those of us with larger ear canals.

author: Albert L.
title: Awesome so far
content:
Really awesome so far, great battery life, around 5-6 hours on a single charge, and charges up quick too. Bluetooth connection is very reliable with my OnePlus 6T. Sound quality is very good. Nice build materials and I love the app. Very fast Bluetooth connection too

Sound: 8.7/10
Noise cancellation: 8.6/10
Comfort: 9.7/10
Connection: 10/10
Material Quality: 9/10
Battery: 9.5/10

I've only had this a few days, I will update my review if anything changes.

UPDATE 11/18/19

*these really are amazing, I have had absolutely no connection issues and they have hold up extremely well definitely buying version 2 once it comes out*

author: Mary
title: Great earbuds
content: I love these little earbuds. They feel good in my ears until a few hours later. The tips start to hurt a little but I just adjust them and then they're okay. I have been told by the other callers, they can't hear me as well but I'm hoping Samsung will release an update to fix that. I still love them and I'm happy with my purchase.

author: Eric Nguyen
title: Get these over the Bose.
content:
The sound quality is 10/10 for me. It might take a couple of tries to find the right size of buds to attach so that they fit snugly in your ear though. But once you do, it blocks out a lot of the sound, and I NEVER put the volume past the "unsafe levels" and I like my music LOUD. Its loud enough that I can only hear my music when jogging, its great.

Speaking of jogging, these things have never once popped out during any strenuous activities/exercise either. Sometimes I'll be upside down for ab exercises and they've never fallen out.

I had tried the Bose wireless headphones before, way too big and clunky, fell out who knows how many times in the 1 week I had them before I returned them. AND the biggest thing that made me return them was because when on a phone call/discord/skype only ONE bud would work. These headphones work together or separately, they're 10/10.

The battery life is great too, I charge them for maybe 30 minutes every couple of days. But I'm not too sure on how long the battery life lasts in total, I generally use them at the gym for 2 hours a day, and a couple hours whenever I'm out of the house for shopping.

If you have android, it automatically connects to your phone the moment you close the case and pop them into your ears. Not too sure about iphone since I don't have one.

I need to get another pair for my mother, hook it up, Samsung!

author: builder
title: poor quality not loud at all
content:
I purchase these headphones about a week ago hoping that they would be awesome.  After trying to wear them they were very comfortable but out of the box completely dead not even 1% battery life witch disappointing for being such a premium product to be shipped completely dead.

sound quality - very little Bass the reason I returned them is at full volume the headphones were not even loud whatsoever I $50 ENACFIRE Future earbuds off Amazon we're probably almost 3x times louder then Samsung at Double the price. I was expecting premium quality earbuds from all the hype from the Samsung commercials I love my S9 but these earbuds are awful.

author: Sieabah
title: They're alright, if you can get them not to cut out
content:
I believe the major issue with this specific product is that it doesn't take much for the signal to cut out. Regardless if you're using a samsung device or not. If you're using a samsung device the likelihood of sync issue goes away, but you still have connection issues.

I cannot go ~20 minutes before my stationary head at work starts to experience audio skips. I don't move when it start happens and it eventually resolves itself. You can force this to happen by covering both of your ears with your hands and the left should go out. So, when you think about how much of your body is in between your right ear and a phone in your left pocket and you're out of luck. Simply unusable for any amount of time.

if the device is not a samsung device the issue happens and has sync issues. It'll be small at first, you'll hear one clip in the audio and all of a sudden the left earbud is a full second behind so you hear double the audio. There is no way to fix this without taking out both earbuds and placing them back in the case, closing it, waiting 5 seconds, opening it, waiting for it to pair, realize it doesn't automatically pair and you have to delete the previous paring and repair it, then place them back in your ears only to have it happen a couple hours later or the next day. Overall a very bad experience and don't know why this product has such a high rating.

My experience has been using a Surface, Note 8, and Macbook, they all experience the same issue regardless of distance to the buds, even being in line of sight of the device & within 2 ft.

Edit: The replacements suffer the same problem and the update released within the past day (1.35) doesn't fix the issue. It actually made the issue worse. I'm still using my Macbook and the ear (closer to the macbook) will lag and delay itself to make the music in phase. Love it! Now when I cover both of my ears with my hands they both cut out and make awful crackling and static noises that would deafen me if I didn't remove my hands.

Returning my pair and going with a product that at least can play music for more than 5 minutes and of a greater distance than 2 feet.

author: Cameron
title: Lightweight Comfortable Sound For Hours
content:
Anyone who says these are lacking sound or Bass must not be using them right or with the right equipment. I have a Samsung Note 9 and these Galaxy Buds complement this phone flawlessly. When I place 1 or both buds in my ear(s) even if bluetooth isn't enabled Samsung technology working in true tandem pops up with that Galaxy Buds notification to ask Connect or Cancel. When paired you can use individually Left, Right or both at the same time. When you use the correct rubber ear peices included in the packaging they sound great. It does take a moment to place them and get them in that comfortable position in the ear but that's because these are so tiny and lightweight. Once they are in I forget they are in! The bass is strong, I don't know how you could expect more bass in a ear bud like this, I mean I love bass, I have 2 12" Memphis subs in my car so I know bass. These have a great balance between bass and treble, just an all around quality sound. These are 100,000x better than those AKG wires headphones that come with Samsung phones like the NOTE 9 and other others. The sound may not be up to BOSE standard but it definitely sounds just like a quality movie theater to me. Quite loud too, I like my music loud and these deliver... maybe a little too well, will be trying to leave these below full volume for my ears sake. Also, the phone calling use with these buds is great. I work in the air on telephone poles and now I can seamlessly switch between music and phone calls with minimal effort. The people on the other end say they hear me great even though it is always windy and blowing right on these ear buds. I can see how if it was noisy like in a large city or event where thousands of people are all yelling around you these may pick up a lot of those voices but like I said it seems like it takes a lot to make phone call quality lack with these. If people like to whisper on the phone or attempt to make a call in a library without disrupting anyone, that might be a little tough because there is a certain low decibel level (normal indoor voice talking volume) these are tuned to work at. I am definitely pleased with these.

My 2 gripes:
1. The case itself is just plastic and I dropped it once, that was it scratched the case right up. Now I have paired this with the araree silicone bean sleeve and I'm good to go for work.

2. These cancel sound so well for tiny ear buds! Which can be a pro or con depending on what you use these for. People used to using Air Pods by Apple might have a tough time adapting to these if they decided to finally do the right thing and switch, lol. Air Pods are a pod style earphone which allows passive sounds to get into your ear along with the music. That open air gap between Air Pod and ear drum can be good and bad. Good if you're using at work and someone comes up behind you and tries to have a full conversation with you while you don't even see they are there. Galaxy Buds cancel outside sounds which can ruin the overall theater-like sound experience when watching movies or listening to music, but obviously makes it tough to hear anyone unless you leave ambient sound on. Ambient sound is a great feature to help with this issue but I think it could still use some improvement.

Overall worth the price and I am very pleased!

author: Alekhya A.
title: My Galaxy Buds Review
content:
I recently purchased the Samsung Buds fromAmazon. I didn't expect them to be this small. I use another brand earbuds which seems too big before Galaxy buds. You know how the craving to use new buds will be. so I tried it extensively over last week. To my surprise, these became my favorites.Now to listen to music and for calls. I kept my other brand earbuds aside. It beats all other brands in size and audio quality. Connecting to Samsung devices was simple, and the calls are audible on both the buds, that's something new. These are small and yet fix perfectly in my ears. Buds never gave any issue connecting to multiple devices. And I tried connecting it to TV. It connected. That's so Cool, right ? Now I can binge watch all my shows without disturbing the house.
Pros:
 --Good for listening to music
--Small enough to fit completely in the ear
--Good charge time and battery life
--There is no ache or pain in the ear if we use it for a long time.
--Doesn't fall off while running or doing jumping jacks.

Con's:
--The buds case is small enough that it can be easily lost.
--Buds need to be properly placed in the case to charge even a small tilt will bring them out
--The case is not scratch resistant
--Not good for Audio calls when outside.

The other day while on was immersed in listening to music at home, My wife came up to and pulled my ear bud out. She was saying 'I have been talking to u and don't you hear me'. I was like I really couldn't hear her while I was listening to music. May be these act as noise cancellation in little.

author: Jared
title: Don't stay in my ears
content:
Sound quality is great, however there are a few things that are making me return these.

The main thing is these don't stay in my ears at all, no matter which fins and inserts I use. Next, the fact that you can't customize all of the touch gestures is extremely annoying. These two problems led to me trying to push them further into my ear and constantly pausing my music.  I don't have good luck with these type of earbuds fitting properly. I need to use over the ear headphones apparently, I'll try airpods but I'm not holding out too much hope.

Battery life is not great compared to cheaper options I've tried either.

Also, if you are buying these for the ambient sound feature like I did, then maybe keep looking. It didn't work for me at all. Even with voice focus, it only picked up the loudest noises (dropping weights, and gym screamers). My wife who was 3 feet in front of me talking was muted by my music, so any conversation with someone who spoke quietly or had a higher voice was imperceptible unless I was violating their personal space.

I love that they charge with Qi or USB-C. The case is very nice and I don't notice it too much in my pocket.

author: ☆Groove•Master☆
title: I love Samsung's Galaxy Bluetooth Earphones! Super Sound and Battery Life.
content: I ordered my Samsung Galaxy Earphones to be Surprisingly Satisfied. I feel Samsung has finally beat out the Apple Earpod. I find the case just the right size and still packs enough battery for several recharges. The ear phones themselves are excellent, great shape that locks into my ear and allows me to lie on a pillow without hurting my ear. I love that I can choose to where one st a time which only extends the battery life that much longer. Its nice that you can charge these wirelessly,  which I'm use to since my last 4 phones from Samsung have had that ability,  but when I upgrade to the Newest Note this Summer 2019 my phone will wirelessly recharge the earphone case if I'm somewhere without a plug. I just can't say enough about these except if your debating between Samsung's Galaxy Earphones and Apples Earpods Samsung Galaxy WINs!

author: Stephanie Campion
title: Best headphones I've ever owned!
content:
I love these ear buds!! They kept falling out at first and I was having trouble connecting them in the beginning, but after reading the instructions again I realized the buds needed to be in the case and that the case needed to be open to connect them. Once i figured that out.. I was very pleased!! They kinda hurt my ears until i figured out how to correctly put them in my ears. But other than that, i love them!!

I had the band around the neck headphones for years and it was nothing like these!

author: soccerguy_250
title: Big Sound in a Small Package
content:
As the saying goes, "good things come in small packages", this certainly holds true for the Samsung Buds. These sleek and compact in-ear earbuds are great for music and phone calls in any situation. The convenient carrying and charging case ensures that the buds are charged and protected while not in use. A great feature of the case is that it can be wirelessly charged using a Samsung wireless charging pad. Charging is quite fast and the battery life lasts a long time. The option to connect via USB-C is available as well.

Connecting to a Samsung phone such as a Galaxy Note9 was very easy. The buds were detected and setup was completed in the Galaxy Wearable app and the buds are configured from within. Once the buds are paired, when the case is opened this automatically establishes a connection to the phone. The battery life indicator shows battery level for both the left and right buds as well as options for configuring the number of taps for various functions. The Equalizer has five modes (Bass boost, Soft, Dynamic, Clear, and Treble boost). There was some noticeable difference between these but nothing that was groundbreaking. A nice feature of the Galaxy Wear app is "Find My Earbuds". When initiated, each bud makes an audible noise that sounds like birds chirping but makes it relatively easy to find them if they're misplaced.

For the small form factor, these produce clear highs and some deep lows. The bass isn't deep enough to rattle any windows but it's good for the size. The active noise cancelling (ANC) does an OK job of blocking out background noise as long as the volume is turned up to about 60%. This was in an office setting where conversations at normal talking levels are occurring.

All in all, these are very well designed wireless earbuds which produce fantastic sound for all occasions. This fits well with the Samsung brand and is a home run in a small package.

author: Michael Wilson
title: Convenient and Functional
content:
Day 2 -
Connection: Unlike some other people, I haven't had problems with sound cutting out while the phone is in my pocket. I've even walked into another room and the earbuds work just fine.
Sound Quality: Good not great. If you've already got some fantastic in ear headphones then these will only serve as a convenience, not a replacement.
Ambient Feature: This is another feature that I liked for the convenience factor but the quality isn't that great. If you want to hear something while you have them in, you can activate this feature but it sounds like it's coming through a tin can.
Battery Life: I haven't used a full charge on these things yet. I checked their percentage periodically while in use and they seem to last a long time. I could probably get through a full work day with some breaks in between.
Comfort: You have to rotate the earbuds so that the fin is pointed up. I feel like the left one isnt as snug as the right but I've had that issue with earbuds before. Maybe my left ear canal is slightly bigger than my right. Overall they are very comfy and light.

I do want to complain about one thing though. The charging cable that comes with the case is plastic and maybe 3.5ft long. I think with the price you're paying they should at least offer a higher quality cable. I guess if they wanted to offer a competitive price to Air Pods they had to cut costs somewhere, right?

author: Ryan R.
title: Good sound. Not for small ears. Noticeable video delay. Disappointing experience
content:
Pros: Price. Sound quality. Design and look. Style and compact size.
Cons: Uncomfortable fit. Noticeable latency in video/audio sync. Missing features with iPhone. Easy to mistakenly activate touch features.

I really wanted to like these. I did extensive research before settling on these. I read most review articles and watched many of the available pre-release video reviews on Youtube. I was comfortable dealing with the iPhone compatibility limitation but was ultimately disappointed with the discomfort of the fit. I tried to deal with it for a few weeks but decided to return them in the end.

The fit wasn't the only issue. The latency/delay of audio with video was too much to deal with. I mostly use Youtube, and while on my commute, my viewing experience was unenjoyable. Anything involving precise action or comedic punchline was virtually unwatchable. I had a $6 pair of Bluetooth in-ear headphones that had better latency than these, so I was very disappointed.

Using an iPhone significantly limits your experience. Upon researching, I was willing to try these with the missing features, but it seems crazy that with all the available apps, Samsung couldn't come up with an iPhone app to allow you at least some of the features (at the time of purchase there was nothing available - not sure what the current app features may be).  Because of this, I can't speak to the functionality of the ambient noise control feature.

Another annoyance was the touch controls. The earbuds are very small (a good thing), so there is limited space for you to handle them. Half the time I was handling them to put them in my ear, I would activate something by accident. Or if I needed to reposition or adjust placement in my ear, it was activate something unintentionally.

If you have bigger ears and a Samsung/Android phone, you'll probably love these. As an iPhone user with small ears, these were no good.

I decided to go with the Anker Soundcore Liberty Air earphones. They kind of look like Airpods, but with soft buds. They fit comfortably and have great battery life for almost half the price. I recommend these as an alternative.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A must have with other galaxy products
content: The sound quality is great with many options to put emphasis on bass, voices, or just even things out. Get this with a newer samsung galaxy phone. I dont see the point of getting these with an iPhone or google phone but you can. Keeps the noises out great and has an option to let you hear your surroundings while listening to music. The battery life isn't the best but with wireless charge it's so simple to just plop them down and pick them up when you're ready to go that you will rarely ever be in danger of having them die. Plus with a newer galaxy phone you can power share in a pinch. The versatility and quality of these earphones are outstanding. This is a must have with other galaxy products.

author: Jose
title: Very decent for the price.
content: I have used many ear buds in my life, I use them mostly at work, I have tried the Bose Sound sports, the truly wireless ones as well, I used to use air pods when I had an iPhone and these sound a little better, they are convenient but there's a huge draw back to them, the call quality is absolute garbage. Everyone that I've called has complained about not hearing me very well, they also get kind of choppy during calls which is why I have to give it 3 stars but everything else is great the battery and recharge rate rival the Air pods. Sometimes it also cuts out, I haven't figured out why its been random but these are good for the price.

author: Jon
title: Nearly Perfect
content: I mostly love these earbuds. I'm using them with an iPhone 8 Plus and there are some minor problems though. Can't get the app for customizing the buds, oh well. But I can't watch YouTube videos while using these as there is a significant latency issue, meaning the audio is out of sync with the video. So far that's the only time I've notice this as Netflix and such seem to be just fine. I can only change volume on my phone which isn't too bad as I can easily hit my volume buttons while my phone is still in my pocket. I've occasionally had an issue with them not connecting when I take them out and have to put them back in the case and out again but it's rare. But they have great audio quality, and they fit great thanks to the different wing and ear tip options that come with them. I like being able to have the touch options for pause/play, skip, back and even siri control with a press and hold. Despite the few negatives with these, they are still my favorite Bluetooth earbuds I've owned. Would definitely recommend unless you're only planning on watching YouTube on an iPhone.

author: W. Wilson
title: Fits perfectly, great sound, and easy to connect right out of the box.
content:
I bought these because I lost my Galaxy IconX (2018) buds, which I really loved.  I was preparing to buy another set, but realized that the new Earbuds had just been released.  As with the 2018 Iconx, they were really easy to connect without issue.

In comparison to the 2018 IconX, the chargin/carrying case is noticeably smaller & lighter, which i definitely appreciate when putting them into my pants pocket.  The case still feels very solid.  In addition to the case being smaller, it feels as if the actual earbuds are slightly smaller and lighter.  I don't notice them in my ear, and yet, they definitely feel secure (not as if they are going to fall out.  This wasn't an issue with the 2018 Iconx either).

The sound seems to be the same (excellent) with good bass and maybe a bit louder than the 2018.  I had found the 2018s were also really good at noise cancellation and so are these.  Note that to change the bass and treble options (as well as other options), you need to download the Galaxy Wear app to your phone.

Definitely happy with my purchase!

Even though the case is smaller, they managed to pack in wireless charging into it, which is very cool.

author: Rondo KV 511
title: work fine inside; random but regular disconnects running; poor outdoor call quality
content:
this is a decent product within narrow bounds but as a warning to runners & cyclists, these WILL disconnect, it's just a question of when. i've had two pairs-- returned the first-- and the second is no better. walking with a phone (LG V30) can trigger the disconnect also btw. i prefer the Samsung over the Airpods for a # of reasons but let's face FACTS: the Apple bluetooth connection is MUCH better (and yes, I use the Galaxy App etc) and there's no comparison wrt to call quality, the Apple destroys it. I'd live with that but the disconnects while running are unacceptable. For what it's worth, my first pair of buds come up as BC33 in my bluetooth settings and the second as C335; I was hopeful that the latter would be an improvement but so far it really isn't.

UPDATE: Outdoors, these connects regularly but randomly in both the crowded city and alone by the waterfront; also, the left and right buds, used separately, both disconnect, i.e. there's no improvement if one is "closer" to the phone, which is in my jacket pocket.

VERDICT: Unacceptable. Samsung has designed a good product but failed to deliver on its potential: stopping to reconnect three or four times in an hour is ridiculous and simply does NOT happen with Airpods, whether using Android or iPhone.

author: josh p.
title: Great for and android users
content: Amazing headphones if you have an android. The app for the headphones is not available on apple devices so you cannot configure any sound profiles, cannot change the functions of the side buttons, cannot activate the passive listening feature so you can hear your surrounding with the headphones on, cannot perform any software updates on the headphones and the active noise cancelling is lost. They mic quality is also absolute garbage if you're in a loud or noisy environment such as a grocery store or warehouse

author: Sunagwa
title: Pretty great...
content:
Came open box. And I mean that literally; it came like the first pic, open, in the box. The buds were also clearly used by someone that doesn't value personal hygiene as much as I do.

The rating system is pretty mediocre so I'll leave it with what it deserves. Ever since I got my free pair of these with my S10+ I have cut the cord. This may vary depending on your particular situation but I use these at least 30hrs a week at my job and the convenience is impossible to beat. So this is where I'm coming from.

The sound quality, like, wow. Really impressed with these.

You can't beat a wired pair. You just can't. I have a pair of FH5's and Sure 846's. The extra power (amps, wattage) they can inherently provide beats out anything currently available. In the end they all use similar drivers; it's the execution and the end result that matters and for a truly wireless set, I'm waiting for something to beat these...

This, for me at least, is the beginning of the truly wireless age.

EDIT: I got these replaced obviously and Amazon sent me yet another open and clearly used item. Was also someone with gross ears. I wouldn't reccomend buying these from Amazon. Two in a row shows that they are clearly, intentionally, restocking returned/used items as new and reselling them as such. I returned the second pair for a refund and ordered Best Buy.

author: Anonymous Buyer
title: Pretty good but one thing...
content:
Get ready for a pretty detailed review fellas.

The pros:
- Decent sound quality; you can switch the codec to scalable in the dev options and it makes somewhat of a difference. as for sound and noise, people say that it is too quiet, don't believe them, they don't know how to work it. You have to change the touch options to when you hold down it will make the volume up, as the headphones have a separate volume than the phone does.
- Excellent noice cancelling; when you put them in your ears, you cant hear people talking around you, especially when music is playing. I have to take them out to talk to people because of how good it is. I've asked people around me if they can hear my blasting music and they say they can't hear a thing so that's good.

In the middle:
- The fit; they have adjustable earpieces in them and you can change them according to your ear size. after a while you start to feel the effect of the wing, but after getting used to wearing them for a day, they don't hurt like they did. I can now wear them for long periods of time without anything hurting. it's just a matter of getting used to it. they also have great bass isolation, just adding that in there.
- The look; I have a small head and I was really sceptical about getting these considering how big they actually are. I got them, and they don't look half bad. they look like they has a price on them when you wear them, like airpods do. They fit in my ears without me looking rediculise.

The cons:
- The only thing I have found to dislike about them is that you can feel that your wearing them. I had a pair of Bose soundsport and when you wear them, you couldnt feel them and it was like it was playing around you but then you'd look and no one was jamming to the music! 10/10 recommend those btw but keep in mind they hurt your ears lot after (it's worth the pain for the sound quality). Sorry went of on a tangent.. The buds let you know how heavy they are (not a lot,but more than others).

out of all I give them about a 8/10. Hope this helps your purchase!

author: jhhack
title: Low Volume, frequent cut outs, poor microphone
content: The pair of Samsung Galaxy Buds that I received are very disappointing.  They frequently cut out when playing music for no apparent reason. The volume is set very low at the factory and the only way to increase it is through the phone.  I do not like to max out the volume on the phone, but have no other choice except to do that when listening in a noisy environment such as on the street.  They do not cancel out noise very well. I have tried different ear bud tips and none seem to seal well enough to block out the noise. The microphone is not very good either. The person on the other end of the call thought I had my hand over the microphone. They could hear me, but barely.  I called Samsung and explained what I was experiencing and they said I got a defective pair and that I should call Amazon and ask for a replacement pair sent out.  That pair is on the way.  I hope all of the issues mentioned above will be resolved with the new pair.  We shall see.  I will update this review once I get the new pair and try them for a spell.  If things do not change, they will go back to Amazon for a refund.  I will go back to my $50 pair that sound better, do not cut out as frequently, and make better calls.  The only drawback to them over the Samsung is the battery life is shorter, about half as long. 5/24 Update:  The replacement pair had fewer problems. but still cut out when playing music, so they were returned and I get a refund.  I will go back to my $50 Ikanzis and I have ordered another pair so I can have longer listening time. When one pair needs to be charged, I will simply use the other pair.  Even though I bought two pair, their total cost is less than one pair of Samsungs.

author: Jorge S.
title: This Buds' not for you
content:
I have the Enacfire 19 and the Jabra Elite 65T, and I am happier with those buds than these. Here are my reservations:
1. The control buttons on the buds are easily activate just by touching either bud when inserting or removing from ears, activating different functions.
2. Range of Bluetooth is very short compare to all other buds I own.
3. Erratic behavior - I am not sure how to explain this but it's like watching 3D without glasses, 2 independent sounds coming out.
4. Screeching noise coming out of the left side. I had to leave the left bud in the car when I went to the gym.
5. The ambient noise sounds like you are in the toilet, and wind sound makes it worst.
6. Callers complaint on quality of the call.

They have been updated to the latest firmware.

I have until the end of May to return the earbuds and right now I am incline to do that. I am going to start searching for replacements. If only the Jabra had magnetic case to hold buds in place, I would repurchase those.

author: Gloria Storti
title: Very good product but some flaws...
content:
These are one of the best wireless ear buds I have had to date, there are some flaws I well get to it later.....

Sound quality is fantastic, but it can be subjective since I am not an audiophile everyone has different opinions. But in all honesty, they sound great, make sure you download the Galaxy wearable app that way you can tune the quality to your liking, I am a bass head so I have it on Bass Boost...

Bluetooth is solid, really good has incredible range, literally, I walked at least 50 close to 70 feet away from my phone and the connection remained strong, it started cutting out when I went further than that. So yes most of the effort definitely went for Bluetooth connectivity very reliable even with phone in pocket, and as soon as you open your pill case they start connecting immediately, not bad Samsung not bad at all....

so why only three stars you ask?

 Let me start off by saying that this review is not meant to sway you off your purchase, these are great you do get your money's worth, but, don't rely on it for phone calls. Phone calls are a hit and miss some people hear me nice and clear others have told me that i'm either too quiet or it sounds slur-ish, it works best in quiet places especially with both earbuds, the earbuds can work independently as well so you can use either the right ear bud only or the left it really doesn't matter. Voice assistant works too, if you say ok/hey google it will pop up, however, it doesn't always work and sometimes it cannot understand you, I find it best if you just change the tap-hold button for assistant but again sometimes it wont understand what you are trying to say to it, either bad mic quality or earbud design ...

But then here comes my second gripe, the touch controls on these are pretty frustrating, they are very sensitive for sure, single tap and tap-hold work just fine but double tap and triple tap are very annoying at times, they would register some times as a single tap, or a triple tap it gets confused, most of the time I just end up whipping out my phone to change tracks. I'm pretty sure this can be fixed with an update, you can change tap-hold to something else and you can also lock out the touch controls, but it locks out all of them, why? why not just lockout some of them not all of them at once? Also give us the ability to modify our tap controls any way we want, why is it limited to only tap-hold? it makes no sense Samsung, get on this man....

Overall, if you don't mind changing tracks with your phone, and you just want to listen to music these work great you wont be disappointed, but these small bugs need to be fixed, never tested the wireless charging ability since I do not have a wireless charging pad but I assume it works....

author: Tom R
title: Great bluetooth ear buds
content: Now that I've been using them daily for a few months I decided it was time to leave a review. The sound quality is very good for an ear bud. While it cannot match the bass and overall sound of a large over ear style headphone, these buds do a great job in a small package. As far as comfort, I have no complaints. They sit nicely in your ear and come with a few size options for the little wing tip that locks it in place. Even while sweating a lot at the gym and moving around a lot I have never had them fall out. The battery life is great, I haven't actually had them die on me yet because any time I'm not using them I put them back in their charging case and they get charged back up to full battery very quickly. I try to remember to charge the case for a little while every day and that has been enough to support using them for a few hours each day at work and also at the gym. The case is small and convenient to carry around, but a little slippery so I have accidentally dropped it or had it fall out of my pocket while grabbing my keys a couple times (and everything still works fine). The only reason I would not recommend these to someone would be if their primary use will be for calls. It seems like the other person has a little trouble hearing me when I talk, but I really don't make many calls with them so that is a not a priority for me. The ambient noise feature works decently if your music is at low volume. It is enough to hear your surroundings while walking indoors, but not great to have a full conversation and if you are outside, it picks up a lot of wind sound making it rather useless. Overall I would definitely recommend these ear buds to anyone with a Samsung phone.

author: GrowingFamily18

content: Wow can you say way too much treble and not loud enough? Yes I am on an iPhone yes I know I don’t have EQ options or internal bid volume change ability but that’s not my fault that’s Samsung’s fault.
