The buds don’t even sit in the case magnetically as good as the EarPods. Apple ear pods sound so much better but I am going to try Jabra elites now to satisfy all curiosity so far Apple wins these suck and my ear hurt so bad!

author: Noel
title: Sound Quality and Battery Life
content: I don't make phone calls with these earbuds so I do not know the quality of sound.  However, they are awesome for music quality.  You can use one earbuds while the other is charging in the case.  That case has an internal battery that you can charge and whenever you put your earphone away they will charge with the built in battery that's in the case.  The case has two LED lights.  One light is internal and the other is external.  The LED colors are green, yellow and red.  I also love the size of the case.  I thought the earbuds would hurt my ears after hours of use but they are comfortable and they do not fall off.  If you happen to misplace your earbuds the app on your phone, "Galaxy Wearable" can find your earbuds.  The earbuds make a chirping sound to locate your misplaced earbuds.  You can also charge these earbuds with, "Wireless Powershare" with your phone or any other wireless charging device.  I've had these for about three weeks and they work great.

author: Nelson Jr
title: Better than expected
content:
I gotta be honest, i didn't love these at first because i thought the volume control was very low and capped off to a certain point with only a volume control on the phone itself. But then i realized the buds can have more volume separately by having volume control turned on at the surface of the ear buds. So it isnt capped off at all.
I like the comfortable fit of these ear buds. The bass is pretty decent. They are a bit pricey for the battery life but do-able. Samsung has been fairly reliable for years.

author: Dewey72
title: Single connections only???
content: In this day in age supporting two profiles is a must (pc and phone, phone and second phone) is a standard and a requirement. Why Samsung would only allow a single connection takes away from all the awesome things these buds can do. One update to the firmware is all it would take. So until Samsung grows up this gets a one. Sorry.

author: pcacsb
title: Work great with my pixel
content: They seem to work fine, don't have too many complaints, main concern was the mic but people on the other end haven't complained so I guess they work. They also don't seem to fall off when I work out and run on the treadmill. I am using a pixel 3 if that helps anyone

author: Eric Chang
title: Well Worth the Price!
content:
I'm always hesitant when it comes to buying earbuds and headphones over $100 but I got these in the mail today and they are definitely worth the price. I've been using my Level U for like two years but I've finally lost all of the rubber earbud covers and they're falling apart anyways so I decided it was time to buy some new ones.

It was decidedly easy to buy these as they are some of the cheapest truly wireless earbuds by a major technologies company out there (I've had mixed success buying off-brand earbuds) and I already have a Samsung phone so I thought it would just work out better. FYI It did!

It's so great to not mess with wires anymore but the one earbud at a time feature is another plus. I know that one of the major complaints is the sound quality, but I haven't seen many issues with it. For $130 the sound is incredible with decent bass. I think some people may expect Harman Kardon or Sennheiser level quality but then go out and buy one of their products then!

You will definitely notice these sit in your ear but with the different sized rubber rings and earpieces, it shouldn't be uncomfortable. That's the tradeoff for the tight fitting secure fit I guess. It does an amazing job canceling out external sound when both are in. One note is that the ambient sound feature does sound tinny in a smaller room because it picks up everything and does leave something to be desired.

Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase and can't wait to try them out on a run now that the weather is nice again.

author: Pigou
title: Great sound, but poor microphone - cannot use for calls
content:
The Galaxy Buds offer a very easy pairing experience, even for non-Samsung phones. I had to install an app on my Pixel 3 XL, which then prompted me to install another plugin (could be better). Still, this took overall just about a minute.

The audio quality is great, although turning off ambient noise made it considerably worse. I don't know why that is, but leaving ambient noise on and setting its volume to zero left me with great sound.

The reason why I'm giving the Buds 2 stars, and why I'll ultimately return them, is the quality of the microphone. I simply cannot use them for calls, either on my Pixel 3 XL (regular phone call or Skype) or on my Surface Book (and Skype). While I have no problem hearing the other person, they can barely hear me. This is not an issue with the signal quality, as I don't have the problem with AirPods or via USB-C headphones with microphone.

I don't have huge demands on the microphones: it's obvious that one shouldn't use them to record a podcast. But having a conversation on a call is not a cutting edge feature and I'm completely perplexed why the microphone is so poor that this is not feasible. I initially thought I might just have a defect pair of Buds, but googling the issue specifically returned a number of reviews raising the same issue.

It's really a shame: they are otherwise well worth the money. But making calls isn't exactly a fringe use of headphones like these...

author: Ana
title: Very decent value for my money
content: Great purchase overall, value for my money. The only thing I really dislike is that all the customizable options are only available through the Samsung wearable app and while the buds work perfectly with my iPad and laptop like any other Bluetooth headphones, I really do wish I could use the ambient mode and equalizer as well. Otherwise, if you don’t care about these settings, it has been a very solid purchase. Battery is very very good, and, though not officially noise cancelling, they do nest in your ears in a way that it feels like noise cancelling as only really loud sound gets through. Ambient noise, doesn’t. Though, when walking with them, you do listen and feel the steps, and it takes time to adjust. Same goes with the buds overall. But again, I would recommend because of the quality and price match.

author: ELL
title: Good for the price, leaves room for improvement
content:
I have had these for a while now, and I also have a pair of the Bose Soundsport Free. If someone could find a way to merge these two products, I would be much happier.

The good:
-Battery life is actually quite good. I have yet to have the battery level warn me it was low, despite heavy use.
-You can use either headphone solo or together. A limitation of the Bose Soundsport Free is you need to use the right headphone, but cannot use the left headphone solo. The Samsung wins on that one feature.
- The charging case is small, easy to toss in a pocket and not notice. The case charges the headphones quickly.
-The "find my earbud" feature is excellent. It makes a loud chirping sound that is easy to hear across the room. The only way to improve it would be to add a sharp finish to the sound  at the end to help your ear focus on location.
-The profile when wearing it is the best I have seen on a completely wireless headphones. They fit snugly and have lots of sizing options.

The Bad
-They have an very limited range. Maybe 15' with clear line of sight.  Putting my phone in my left pocket while using only the right earbud leads to a choppy signal, at best. With the Bose, I can go 35' away with walls between my phone and the earbud and have clear, crisp sound. The shorter distance with the reception is probably something that helps the battery life on the Samsung over the Bose, but can be irritating.
-The sound quality is mediocre. Especially compared to the Bose. Acceptable for the gym and most activities, but if you are an audiophile, you will be frustrated with the sound quality.

Summary-
Solid package. I use them more than the Bose. The case is smaller, the individual earbuds can be used independently of the other, and the battery life if much better. The earphone block noise well, are intuitive, and fit well. The signal strength leaves A LOT to be desired. It is my biggest gripe, but not a deal breaker.

author: David E K.
title: Excelente
content: excelente es lo que puedo decir después de cambiar mis audífonos icomx edición 2018 ya que con esos tenia problemas debido a que se desconectaban varias veces debido el sensor de proximidad con estos samsung buds no tengo ningún problema hasta el momento ademas de quedar perfectos en la oreja

author: M. Murad
title: [3.5/5] Best for music, average for calls, 1 day of battery
content:
Pros:
-Good isolation (No ANC)
-Flawless music quality
-Good call quality in normal conditions (office, home, car,..)
-Fully customizable touch controls
-Sensitive touch controls
- very small case (Airpods size)

Cons:
-Not for calls in very noisy environments like a cafe. Other side will definitely complain.
-Pass through isn't really beneficial, specially it doesn't work during calls.
-Battery life is terrible. 1.5 days max of average use. I get 3 days with Airpods.

author: SUMMRA SHOAIB
title: Great sound and Comfort
content:
Hope this review helps. The Galaxy bud are a great design and fits comfortably in my ear. They do come with different size ear pieces so people can adjust them to meet their needs.
Connection: Once paired to my S9+ the buds auto connect whenever I open them from their case. As far as distance, my buds can be about 10 - 20 feet away from my phone before the signal gets lost or shady.
Features: The touch sensor on the device gets a little getting use to, but once you have the figuration set to your liking it very easy.  The pill box case is light and easily placed in a pocket, going to purchase a sleeve with a clip for it so i can have on my belt instead.
Sound: Great quality on the sound, once ear buds are in they pretty much cancel most of the background noise and the bass and clarity of what you are hearing is amazing.
Call quality: Now here is what makes the score drop. So when people call me I can hear them with such great clarity, however in most cases that can't be said about me. Called a few different people and most said my voice came in very statically and like an echo. I tried calling to in a busy and loud environment first and the call were worst, when in a quite place the quality was better. Did not have this issue with my LG Tone Headset.
Easy of access: The downside to this product is that you have to carry a case with it constantly, whenever you get a call you got to pull the case out and place the ear bud in then answer your calls. very time consuming. now they work great if your

author: Heather Smith
title: Great quality, subtle appearance, not the greatest for sleeping
content:
The sound quality is very good. The carrying case is more compact than I had originally thought, and they pair with my phone before I can even put them on.

I like to sleep with music playing, but wired headphones are a bit difficult to do that with. I was hoping these would be a fantastic solution to that issue, and it sort of was. Sort of. They make it extremely easy for me to fall asleep, but when I wake up, they're both out of my ears. I've heard that some people can go the whole night without them falling out, but that has never happened to me so far. Don't get me wrong, I love these earbuds, I just wish they would stay in at night.

author: giovanni
title: Good but could be better
content: I like these buds, I had the iconx 2018 before and these definitely have better sound but I have experienced a little bit of interference making my audio a bit choppy when I'm outside, the only way I've managed to reduce it is walking with my phone in my hand in a clear line of site, in my pocket it made more chopping. The touchpads on the side work well but personally I would've preferred the touch controls on the iconx which for me make interacting with the earphones easier. Overall there solid earphones but if you want a really secure fit with all wireless earphones the iconx 2018 may be a better option.

author: ChrisWearsGlasses
title: Not for Those with Sensitive Ears
content: I've been a day one Airpod user so trying something new really intrigued me. Upon receiving the Galaxy Buds I was really excited, small earbuds, usb c/wireless charging, great sound quality, they seemed like the whole package. Unfortunately after using them for more than an hour I proceeded to get light headed. I thought, "Hey you're probably just tired." but after trying them out for a few days now the same thing happens each time I use them. I was reading up on it and apparently I fall into the small percentage of people who get motion sickness due to the noise isolation and in ear rubber tip. I wish these worked for me, I love the sound quality. Hopefully next round will be more suited for me.

author: Kevin Arbuckle
title: These things are amazing!!
content:
These work great for wireless earbuds. Extra pieces are included which allows you to customize the Galaxy Buds to your ear. You have 12 different ear shape/size combinations! The ambient noise mode helps out, greatly, but it not very useful with your music turned all of the way up, which is expected.
One thing to note is that talking on the phone with heavy wind causes the person on the other end to hear it for sure, but that is expected with most bluetooth earpieces that do not have a foam cover on the microphone.
I love these earbuds!!!

author: Fernando Castillo
title: Good enough to enjoy
content: Overall this is a fairly decent product. I gave it 3 stars on mostly sound quality and fit. The sound is nice for a room setting and/or no so loud public places. The fitment was ok and you have to get use to it bc it feels awkward at first. Aside from that it always feels like it's going to fall out with a little bit of sweat. I never had enough confidence on fit and I'm always having to readjust them. Maybe it's just me. Ambient sound adjustment is nice to have and it works, and you need to have SamsungWear app to use it.  Overall they are good. Would recommend them for light to moderate use.

author: Ray
title: Better than Airpods
content: Personally I'm not a fan of "deep fit" earbuds. But they are more secure than airpods. I ended getting these after returning my airpods because I couldn't get the most out of the airpods from a Samsung device and I must say I'm happier. I'd recommend trying all of the wing tips and ear tips to find your fit before you decide that they aren't for you. My only concern is the battery case only gives you 7 more hours as opposed to the airpods 24 hours.. CMON MAN THATS RIDICULOUS. Touch controls work great actually, work better than the airpods touch controls and more options per bud too. Really these are better than airpods in every way other than the case's battery life. Cheaper too. Also note that the wing tips may cause some pain in your ear after an hour of wearing them or so, so keep that in mind. It doesn't bother me so much but this can be a deal breaker for most. So comfort is more of a 2 out of 5 star.

author: Cortez S.
title: Not worth the money
content:
Okay....so if the only thing you want to do with these is listen to music, than these are great headphones, sound quality is good to say least.
If you plan on using these for actual conversation though...NO. stay away. When talking on the phone, (if one of the buds isn't  just randomly dead that is ) the other person can barely hear you. At first I thought maybe it's them, but I decided to download a call recording app and it's terrible. The battery life, last maybe 3 hours then you hear beeping and its time to recharge. Can't even find a replacement charging case if you lose yours, so keep it close cause you'll definitely need it.

Truckers definitely stay away.

author: Mitchell Myser
title: I was hoping for something better.
content:
I had a lot of hope in these earbuds. As a previous owner of the Iconx 2018, I was expecting some of the same feature passed down. For instance, on the Iconx 2018, you could set the main earbud to left or right. This was handy when running with my Garmin. Connection issues happen when the main earbud is set to the opposite ear of the arm your watch is own. So the watch is on your left arm and main bud is in your eight ear. This causes the connection to drop out continuously. This is something great the Iconx had. You could change it to any ear. This feature is lost to the Galaxy Buds. I have to change the watch to my opposite arm to combat this, and it's quite awkward

The biggest let down was they had no internal storage. This was very disappointing, as this was my favorite feature on the Iconx. I understand they wanted to cut the size down but they took away what made the Iconx so great.

I haven't decided whether I want to return them or not. If someone can tell me how to set the main earbud or get around this, I'll change my review. This doesn't mean telling me to move my watch to the other arm.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best earbuds I've tried!
content: I love these wireless earbuds! I've tried so many others but they all had various issues and the worst being people did not understand me when I was speaking on the phone especially when the batteries were low.  I love that you can use these as a pair or use thr right or left ear bud by itself. You can take them in and out of your ear without disconnecting the call. The sound quality is good but I wish it was a little louder but this would possibly damage your hearing so where it is works. It also has a nice feature that alerts you when thr battery is low and needs to be charged. The charging cradle does a fine job of giving you additional power on the run. The cradle also has a longer charging cable than all the others I've tried. There's also a handy app that you install for these earbuds that also lets you know the battery life in percentages. Another thing I love is the ease of paring these and the ease of them connecting with Bluetooth whether it is on a mobile device or with the hands-free module in my car. Finally, the earbuds are very comfortable to wear for long periods of time. They have a little wing that helps them stay put while they are in your ear.

author: Max Carlson
title: Connectivity Issues. Incredibly high latency
content:
The sound isn't bad for truly wireless earbuds.
My earbuds have pretty annoying connectivity issues with the Bluetooth dongle I have for my PC, but I'm going to try a different dongle before I judge them on that.
If your planning on watching many TV/Movies with them I would pass. They have some of the highest latency of all the wireless earbuds at 320ms and they don't feature the aptX low latency audio codec (unless you're exclusively streaming from a Samsung phone which apparently uses a lower latency audio codec). This translates to a very noticeable delay between peoples lips and the actual sound.
The earbuds are relatively comfortable. After 4-5 hours of having them in I do sometimes experience enough discomfort that it's obnoxious. Oddly enough, smiling or laughing while they're in can be pretty uncomfortable.

I would only recommend these if you're planning on using them exclusively (or at least mainly) for music during a workout or listening to podcasts around the house.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not as good as hyped up to be
content:
I was very excited to get these when they came out. I ordered them as soon as I could. But after having them for a week I am not as impressed as I hoped I would be. That being said I will be keeping them.

Pros
- Comfort,  these are extremely comfortable in my ears.
- Sound quality,  these buds sound great and have good bass. I love how they seal in my ears to block out other sounds when I really want to jam out
- Battery life/charging case,  they seem to live up to the 6 hour life and i like that i can put them back in the case to get some extra charge.
- Wearable app,  easy to navigate and like i can change some of the tap gestures.

Cons
- The ear buds occasionally have gone out of sync requiring me to remove one bud and putting it back  my ear so they are synced together.
- Ambiant sound mode automatically turns off when you remove one ear bud and you have to go back into the app to turn it back on. I have the long tap gesture set to volume so I can't turn it back on that way.
- I expected more out of ambiant sound mode. I bought these for going to the gym hoping that I could have a conversation with my wife and still listen to music. I can do this without having to remove a bud but do have to pause my music to hear her.
-  Blue tooth,  this issue I think is with my Galaxy S8 but cannot confirm. When I am outside I cannot put my phone in my pocket or swing my arms when walking as the connection drops in and out.

Overall I am happy enough with them to keep them but for $130 I expected a lot more from them and am kind of disappointed. Hopefully some of these issues can be fixed with firmware updates.

author: Juwuan
title: Great headphones, bad amazon service experience.
content:
So after reading lots of good and bad reviews, I gave them a try for myself. I've had them got A day and so far I'm pretty impressed honestly. I didn't have the gear iconx or whatever the predecessors to these were. I went for a decent length walk yesterday with Lots of stuff in my pockets along with my phone and had minimal sputtering, by that I mean once. The buds never came out of sync with one another fortunately as I had also read.
These buds are super immersive with their sound and I really like the quality of the sound, very full but the bass could be a little fuller, but its still pretty good, especially for wireless headphones.
The call quality for me was fine, not stellar, but when I got a call yesterday on my walk, I answered the call with my buds and left the phone in my pocket and kept walking and the call went smoothly. I was walking along a busy street and the person on the other end had no issues hearing me.
The down side wasn't on part of the buds, but amazon really. I didn't appreciate this, "free one day shipping" then my package didn't get to me causing me to have to go to the post office the next day and the told me that the package had just come in right before I got there. Amazon told me that my Apt wasn't accessable and told me that's why my package wasn't delivered. If it's really two day shipping, just say that.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Replacement Parts NOT Available
content:
For the few days I had the buds I loved them . Sound quality was awesome.  Connection with my Samsung 10E was seamless.  Comfort in my ears was so good sometimes I forgot I was wearing them.
The story turns sour when I discovered that I lost my charging case somewhere between home and the grocery store.
Why? Because when I contacted Samsung they told me that I could not buy a replacement case. I had to buy complete set, and there are no known plans of ever having parts replacement for it in the future.
Long story short: DON'T LOSE YOUR  BUDS or CASE! That is unless you are okay with buying the whole thing over again. So, buyer beware.

author: Brian H.
title: NO THEY WON'T FALL OUT!
content: Ok, I was skeptical on making the switch to true wireless since I work around water and well garbage disposals lol. After a few days I realized these things are not falling out, unless of course they are directly hit. I used the Beats X before these and the sound on Beats are very loud, that being said Galaxy Buds could use one or two more notches on the volume up button. They could be louder for me since I work in a noisey place, but they get the job done listening to Howard Stern everyday at work (BABABOOEY TO Y'ALL). For example if your on say a riding lawnmower these won't work at all sound wise, I use my OVER ear beats in that situation. These are snug, very sharp looking, and well worth the $125 price tag. Battery last all day during my 8-10hr workday, if you're not using em throw them in the case so they can charge wirelessly another great feature. Also the Galaxy Wearable App makes these customizable, bottom line must give these buds a 8.5/10 only the max volume hurts these in my opinion.

author: Magnus
title: Exactly what I wanted in true WIRELESS. Top 5 Purchase of 2019.
content: I love these. Works seamlessly with my Note 8 or 9. No stuttering connection. Very good sound. Ultra comfortable. You can use one while the other is charging. The touchpad controls work very well. It let's you change ambient sound and volume usage by using the app when you hold pad. Bluetooth 5.0 shows no latency issues on Amazon prime or any other vids you watch. One of my top 5 purchases of the year.

author: Cody W.
title: No static disconnection
content:
These are actually good name brand wireless headphones. Before I got these I kept trying out cheaper ones like one called iKanzi and I tried THREE different ones and all of them when walking (with the phone with you in your pocket) would keep loosing connection and not playing it. These headphones ALWAYS keep connection when I'm walking and even if my phone is stationary and i'm moving around. These are actual named brand headphones from Samsung. I feel that these or the usual Airbuds are your only good wireless ones. The cheap ones are not worth it. The sound quality is also good on them. You may not get anything that's extreme theater sounding (If you want that then get the huge wired ones), but it's good for wireless standards.
It is also very comfortable and don't even have to struggle to get them in place in your ears!
All around great headphones that I would strongly recommend!

author: The associate
title: Good, not great
content:
Great for commutes, exercising, running, and just want to listen to a podcast. It's not ideal for dedicated music consumption. There are alternatives such as the soundpeats that offer much better audio quality, however with any other smaller brands they're limited in functionality or practicality.

Like the Airpods, these buds allow for single side use and gestures. Cheaper alternatives require some awkward fumbling to pause the music or worse pushing a button on the ear piece--this drives the ear piece into your ear and needless to say, it kind of hurts/uncomfortable.

Using this with Spotify premium (Android), I had to tweak the equalizer settings to get a comfortable listening experience without cracking the highs and the lows were kind of muted. Regardless, it's underwhelming coming from a wired experience.

Who would I recommend this to? If you like Airpods but you use an android device... Better yet if you own a Samsung device, without a doubt this provides the best listening experience. I'm not sure if it's intentional or not, it sounds and works twice as good/well than on my Pixel 3 XL.

If you're conscious of spending or on a budget, the aftermarket alternatives will do you a solid that will be hard to beat.

author: MrJohnWeez
title: Don't update these to the latest firmware
content: I had an original pair of galaxy buds that I used for a couple weeks then I updated them and they were a lot louder out of one of the ears. Then I got them replaced through amazon and used those for about a week until I decided to update them and see if they would work after updating, thinking that it was only a problem with the other pair. After the update I tested them and they did the same thing that the first pair did. Bottom line is that these are good earbuds, but something with the update makes these $130 earbuds turn into something that has the same problems as $1 earbuds. I only gave these a two star rating because they were decent when they worked good and because of amazon's exceptional return policy.

author: Ivan A Olvera
title: So much for new. . . .
content: Ordered a set of galaxy buds but was cautious when the package arrived. There was a lot of loose items from what I could hear and when I opened the box, the package had opened. If they were new as described, there would be no way that would've happened. The original seal had been opened and was resealed with regular office grade tape. . . highly disappointed

author: J. Flege
title: Better iOS support will make these earbuds 6 stars!
content: The Samsung Galaxy Earbuds are everything wonderful as advertised.  However, I feel like the red headed stepchild left out of all the really helpful and useful information constantly referred to as the Samsung Wearable App for the Galaxy Earbuds.  Unavailable for the iPhone, so all of that is simply unavailable for us disadvantaged iPhone users.  Having said that pairing was simple and uncomplicated.  But what is that pesky, constantly recurring tone I keep hearing in the left earbud even when 100% charged.  Impossible to get answers from Samsung because, you guessed it, their knowledge base is an impenetrable Chinese firewall when it comes to iOS.  I'll continue to enjoy using these since they are heads above the Apple AirPods.  Maybe Apple will get with it and come up with something like these.

author: The Dude
title: Great wireless earbuds.  Super small.
content:
Sound quality is great.
Phone calls sound excellent and I have been told I sound good.
Love that I can wear them to bed and they don't stick out so far I cannot lay my head on the pillow.

Charge lasts a good amount of time.

Only negative is you can only use them with one device at a time. Which is not a huge problem for me.

Love that Ican use it with only one bud at a time and either works.

Would like volume controls. but not enough to increase the size.

author: GamerSpectrum
title: Doesnt work properly after 2 weeks dont buy
content: Doesnt work properly after 2 weeks dont buy, whenever i call my wife is makes a super loud obnoxious noise and she cant handle listening to it this was a horrible purchase. The mic is just gone on this thing in just 2 weeks and i kept it in perfect shape.

author: Michael Weisenbarger
title: Very nice wireless buds; not sure they are better than the IconX buds
content:
So let me set the scene, I have both the IconX(2018) and just got my new black Galaxy Buds yesterday. I have had the IconX's for about a year now. So let me run though my list.

1. This is easily the best part of these buds: they are SUPER COMFORTABLE! I almost can't even tell they are there. I have been wearing them for hours (part of that time with a beanie on and part without). They are simply a joy to wear. A big upgrade from the IconX comfort which plenty to be desired. Also the fit on these exceed the IconX. I have a weird left ear canal and shape and never could get the IconX's quite right but the galaxy buds work perfectly. So if fit and comfort are the most important things to you then I highly recommend these.

2. Sound Quality - It's about the same as the IconX's despite being "tuned" by AKG. Volume is roughly the same. If the IconX's volume got an 8, I would say the galaxy buds get to 7.75. Bass is good enough as is treble. The mids are alright too; I'm not a huge audiophile but they sound very nice.

3. Noise Isolation - top notch; they filter out sound quite well. I will say the ambient sound feature on them is CRAP compared to the IconX's; the IconX's ambient sound was much better. If you care about that sort of thing.

4. Touch Response - its very touchy. If you press too quick it'll only register the first tap. So you have to slow down a bit and I don't like that cause the IconX's didn't need that. Plus remember that they removed the swipe up/down for volume controls (which I hate that they did that) so you are stuck with a tap and hold (right bud does volume up and left does volume down and NOPE you cannot remap this).

5. Software - IconX is winner here. They removed the tap and hold and it would cycle through your list of available options (like ambient sound on/off, voice command, start workout, etc) but as mentioned above they removed the swipe for volume. This is a huge step back Samsung.

6. Connectivity - I keep my phone in my front left pocket and my IconX's would very rarely disconnect/crackle for a moment or two. The Galaxy buds do it every single time I turn my head in any direction. I moved my phone to my jacket pocket and that essentially fixed it. That isn't viable for year round though; I hope Samsung fixes this with a software update as this is crap.

7. Battery - it's fine; but overall the IconX's would last longer in the long run as its case held more of a charge. However, the wireless charging case is nice. But I was fine with just the wired USB-C charging of the IconX's.

8. Long term frustrations - I cannot say as I haven't had the buds very long however the IconX's had this super annoying problem where ear wax would sneak its way into the canal of the bud and block most sound. You had to take off the screen, clean the canal, and replace with a new screen (thankfully supplied by Samsung in abundance). I don't think the GB's will have this issue but that remains to be seen. They don't include a repair kit with these so I'm assuming they don't expect it to happen.

9. They removed the internal 4gb of storage. Why Samsung, I used the heck out of that. I love going out for a run/jog and not have to take my phone OR smartwatch. I would pay for that; I think others would too.

With the removal of the volume swipe, the tap and hold scroll through list, lesser battery and sound that isn't any better than last year's model I'd have a hard time recommending these over the IconX model. The comfort, fit, smaller size, wireless charging case, and multiple color options are about the only things the new buds have going for them. I love Samsung products but this one isn't as good as I hoped it would be. It isn't bad either. YMMV.

author: J.haskin
title: Samsung Does it Again
content: At first glance these appear no different from last years Galaxy buds.....wrong. Greatly improved design for sure. Much better fit and amazingly light weight. No discomfort after long term use. Which brings me to the point that long term use is possible with not only amazing battery life but the multiple convenient charging options. From the additional charge ability of the case itself, to wireless charging off your phone or pad, to simply plugging it in to the same usb C your phone uses. Sound quality is quite impressive for the compact size. Easy to adjust EQ levels create a great sound of your preference. Bass comes thru great without sacrificing clarity like other earbuds might. Call quality has been the most impressive. My callers cant even tell I'm using a headset. The noise cancelling has definitely improved in this model. "Quick Ambient" is probably my favorite new feature. with just a touch of one ear you can engage external mic and hear all around you. such a simple yet handy feature. Not only did they improve this product but the price got even better. Win Win! Highly recommend

author: Jeff Folger
title: works as advertised
content:
I've been using them daily and the sound quality is great, no doubt. My only worry is losing one while eating or bending over. I have tried the different coverings but they still loosen over time. You can tell they are less by feel and more by sound quality.
Also when I turn them off to listen to someone it sounds like I have earplugs in and they are muffled. I have to stop the music and take one out. Maybe I have them set up wrong but I thought they were to allow the flow of sound in much better.

author: Jacqueline Smith
title: Not for hands free talking
content:
Call Quality - 0 out of 5. These are not for hands free talking. You will be able to hear your caller just fine. The sound on your end is great. However, your caller will be able to hear every single sound and noise in your background including hearing you swallow if you take a drink. Lol. They will not be able to make out what you're saying. I have not had one successful call with these. I was walking around the mall, I answered my friend's call. She could instantly tell something was off and different. My friend asked me what kind of 2003 Bluetooth device did I get and that I should throw them in the trash. And she wasn't the only call I've answered and my caller was like "please disconnect me from your Bluetooth device". So... Not for hands free talking. At. All.

Sound Quality - The sound, 5 out of 5. Beautiful sound quality. There's an equalizer with different options. I love the bass. It's very easy to become immersed in what you are listening to.

Noise Cancellation - These are ONLY for listening and possibly noise cancellation if you need it. The noise cancellation is 5 out 5. It actually concerned me at first because I couldn't hear ANYTHING in my surroundings. The ambient option helps you to be aware of your surroundings, other than that, be careful and be alert.

Battery - no complaints. It has always later as long as I needed. And when I'm not using them, I put it back in the case and it's at 100% again. 5 out of 5.

Bluetooth Connection - 4 out of 5. I'm not sure if it's the range, the walls, or when the battery gets low, but it makes this awful digital scrambling sound when the Bluetooth connection is breaking up. My apartment is a little less than 800 sqft. My phone can be in the living room, if I walk in the closet, the sound will scramble. I rated it 4 and not 3 because of the effortless connection. Just open the case and it automatically pairs to the phone. I have a Note 8.

Charging case - 5 out of 5. It's very small. I have clumsy hands so I have dropped it and lost it several times. Lol. That's a me problem though. It has the same c-type USB charging port. Super convenient.

Other functions - 4 out of 5. If you drop an earbud and can't find it. Click on where's my earbud and it will begin to beep louder and louder. I wish it did that for the whole case. The tapping functions to turn volume up or answer call (it's customizable) are fine. No real issues.

author: F T. A.
title: Ok, I Give Up On Wireless Headphones For Now
content: I sampled the three top wireless headphones. They all fall short. This Samsung was the worst of them all. Sound quality was awful. There was NO bass! Half Mid, and the treble was so tinty that the ear speaker would make a cracking sound. Samsung, If you read this, please go back to the drawing board. All of these companies must take these off the market and start over again. It is not fare for consumers to pay this price to have very poor quality.

author: Joy Horvath
title: Connectivity nightmare
content: I can't express how frustrating it is to use these things. The sound quality is good, the passthrough to hear the outside world is decent... Providing you have direct, unobstructed view of your phone from less than three feet away. If I put my phone in my pocket I start getting audio disruption. If I put my phone on the table in front of me and then try to knit--disrupted signal!! Yes, my aluminum knitting needles apparently are enough to disrupt the connection on these things. I can't even count on getting uninterrupted audio while holding my phone *in my hand* when I walk. The mic is also garbage, something I was embarrassed to discover while attempting to conduct a business call. I've attempted all of the recommended troubleshooting techniques and it's never improved. I'm so annoyed at the quality for the price of these things. Unless you plan on using these purely to connect to your phone as it sits on a desk next to you while you do nothing but sit still, avoid these like the plague.

author: Alessandro Di Paola
title: Great Earbuds with Great Sound Quality
content: These earbuds are awesome! The sound quality is very good and their noise cancellation makes you feel like youre in your own world. In regards to build quality they are built well and they stay in my ears perfectly. I would highly recomend making sure you have the correct ear tip size and ear fin installed. There are various reviews stating these are not loud enough, to fix this issue make sure to go into blutooth settings on your Samsung device and toggle "Media Volume Sync".  This will make the volume louder and sound better. Samsung also released an update to fix the bluetooth connection issues that some were having. I have waited over a week to post this review and can assure you these are great wireless earbuds.

author: Alcyone
title: GROSS! - Arrived Nasty
content:
⚠️ I've always had good quality products from Amazon. This one is NOT one of them.

I'd like to start off by saying the Samsung Galaxy Buds functionality review is #2 here and is separate from the main point.

#1: Nastiest package from Amazon ever. These buds came Very USED condition with oils and ear wax crusted to the device and charge container. Bought to use before going on a trip making it pointless to return at the time. Should have paid considerably less for having to sanitize them. Minor scratches on package after finding items were scattered, fully apart, thrown around in large shipping box.
Possibly the most disappointed I've been for conditions of a shipment in years. (4k picture uploaded, apologies for grossness)

#2: Samsung Galaxy Buds functionality: Still quite the upgrade from the first bluetooth set produced from Samsung. The size is perfect for small ears and has sizing to adjust for larger. Range is massive, best upgraded feature imo aside from size reduction.

Will update if new opinions.
Thanks for reading 🙂

author: Christopher Asgian
title: By far the best option if you have a Samsung phone
content:
I chose these to go with my Samsung Galaxy S8 over Apple's AirPods with the hopes that same-brand connectivity and functionality was worth any compromises in design, quality, and battery life.

In terms of design, they far exceeded my expectations.  At about $30 cheaper than AirPods, I actually prefer the design of the case and earbuds Samsung offers.  The soft rim and earpiece come in 3 sizes each, and I found that after swapping to the smallest, they fit snug but are comfortable for hours. I have run in them without any need to adjust them at all, a first for me with any headphone or earbud.  The touchpads on the earbuds are easy to use and one function is programmable.  The case is tiny... smaller than the AirPod case or any I have ever seen.  The bottom allows for wireless charging, a nice feature, but they do come with a high quality USB-C charger.  The earbuds rest in the case with magnets securely.

In terms of quality, the fit & finish is comparable to every Apple product I have ever purchased - high praise for sure.  The earbuds are very light, but sturdy.  They connect automatically after one seamless setup process (much easier than any other Bluetooth experience I've had) once you take them out of the case.

Regarding battery life, Samsung claims 6 hours, but I haven't had to push it nearly that far.  I have found after 3+ hours half-volume listening from full charge the earbuds are generally around 60%.  I firmly believe the battery life drawback is a sacrifice for the smaller case, which I'd rather lose personally.

All things considered, these are excellent "truly wireless" earbuds, I highly recommend them, especially if you have a Samsung phone.  If you travel often or want to put them in your pocket, these have the smallest case yet. Battery life is reasonable but not near first-class, and the overall design and build quality are excellent.

author: Tbone
title: Almost awesome
content: They're pretty rad, and I do enjoy them.  The sound quality is good for these type of buds.  No complaints there.  I did expect that the mic quality wasn't great, but I don't use them for calls.  I use them mostly for the gym.  The one feature i wish worked better was the passthrough audio.  It's not great.  I very much like to have the ability to stop my music and talk to somebody and hear them amplified through the headphones but its really tough to hear people through them.  I still end up taking them out to talk to someone.

author: BecauseITry
title: Workout and yard work ready. Great battery life, and multi-feature button is great.
content:
I wanted headphones that I could wear to the gym and not need a wire attached to my phone or even around the back of my neck. A friend had these and I knew I had to try them.

They do not fall out. I can run, jump, accidentally hit myself in the head with a rake, they don't go anywhere. The battery lasts and lasts and they charge very quickly when it finally runs out. And the case is convenient to carry around without needing a ton of space.

As much as I enjoy trying to blow out my ear drums and ruin my hearing, these just don't quite do it but are plenty loud enough. The sound quality is quite good, but you won't get a whole lot of bass simply due to how small these things are.

The only word of caution I would give is for people with in-ear piercings. I have a daith, which sometimes gets a little uncomfortable with the earbud after several hours of wear, and that earbud will often discharge a little faster because it occasionally contacts the metal of my earring. But it's hardly enough to annoy me, they're great earbuds.

Sometimes people don't notice I'm wearing them, which can be fun when they start talking and it seems I'm ignoring them, but hey, the noise cancelling works really well!

author: Gogogadget
title: In-Ear Goodness
content: I've owned and tested the galaxy buds for about 3 weeks now and I love them! I've previously owned the jaybird x2's and jaybird freedom but these are my go-to headphones for working out! They fit well and dont fall out of the ear even during sternous exercises. They include different sizes of ear tips to ensure a proper fit for most ears. Connectivity was simple! If you have a newer samsung phone, all you need to do is flip the lid open to the galaxy bud case and the phone detects them itself and asks if youd like to connect. If you have an Apple phone, you have to go in to your settings and manually pair the ear buds after opening the case. The best part is, you can choose to use only 1 earbud at a time! The sound quality is good after being tweaked using Samsung's equalizer. So far, I haven't needed to charge my buds as the case charges them back to 100% everytime I put them in. All in all I think these are a step above the icon X buds. These were given to me at a discounted price to review.

author: Dennis Plautz
title: If you buy the black color the directions provided are not in english
content: I bought these buds for a very specific purpose.  In the use I choose the sound quality and noise cancellation is not tested.  I did experience a first in my buying history.  The warranty card that was packaged with my black ear buds was in English and Spanish.  Strangely, the instruction sheet enclosed was in a single language, Spanish.  The order shows I ordered the product for US utilization.  I went on line and could not find the instructions in English.  Where can I find the instruction sheet in English?

author: Mark G
title: Left earbud is louder - had 2 different sets with the same problem.
content:
This is my second pair of Galaxy buds, the left earbud is noticably louder. I returned the first pair for the same issue. The audio was noticeably louder on the left side. If I reversed the earbuds and put them in the wrong ears, the audio was noticeably in the right. So it isn't my ears. I tried them with multiple devices just to cover all my bases, same problem. Two in a row with the same issue, that is terrible quality control. I wanted to like these earbuds, but I'm not interested in listening to music and podcasts on my left.

Would not recommend.

author: Amazon Customer
title: No giant things hanging out of my ears.
content: Excited to be able to get rid of these weird air pods.

author: Michael Guzman
title: THE REAL DEAL!!!
content: If you own the Samsung Gear Iconx's and you are thinking about upgrading, these will not disappoint! The sound quality is much better and the case is way smaller and more compact. I used the gear iconx's mainly for my job which I work outside all day and one of the earbuds gave out in less than two years of using them not sure because of my sweat or just a hardware malfunction. I was hesitant at first of purchasing the Samsung Galaxy Buds because of all the hype, but then I seen all the positive reviews and decided to get them. I AM TRUELY ENJOYING these earbuds and how they sound at work in noisy environments. The clarity in the vocals and the pretty punchy base definitely delivers your money's worth and I cannot say this enough times "BETTER THAN THE GEAR ICONX'S"!!!!

author: James
title: Impressive little ones!
content:
I bought this earbuds last month.First of all,I love this tiny little design...I saw earbuds design are mostly look like bigger in the ears and this one is perfectly fit in my ears and look like agents in the movies.And the sound quality is pretty dope.It's better than I expected.I can hear the music pretty clear...beats are impressive and it's a little bit better than AKG earphones.Noise cancellation is perfect for me,I can't hear anything during listening music and I can enjoy fully the music(With Wired AKG earphones,I can still hear environment sounds).Touch button features are cool.
There's only one thing...it's getting weak bluetooth signals and interrupt the music.So,I hope this kind of problem will be solved soon by software update.So,I gave it 4 stars.

author: Jere Palitz
title: Don't buy them, they are horrible.
content: I really wanted to like these headphones, but 2 HUGE issues prevent these headphones from being even tolerable.  The first is that the sound stutters a lot if your phone is not out in the open.  Ie if you have your phone in your pocket, you'll experience "skipping" audio.  What's the point of wireless headphones if you have to hold your phone?  The second issue was the sound quality people experienced on the other end of my calls.  I was told often that I could not be heard or that there was a loud jackhammer sound.  On my end the sound quality was decent and I did not hear any of these jackhammers noises, but it was reported by multiple people on multiple days, so it wasn't a one off situation.  If you go and google these problems you will see they are being reported by a lot of people.  I tried all of the troubleshooting steps suggested, like resetting the buds, making sure the software was up to date, etc, but nothing worked.  Just don't buy these!!!!!!

author: Joseph Manko
title: Each ere battery drains at different speeds
content: They fit nicely in the eres. They sound great  the noise cancelling could be better. The big problem with them is that the right ere will drain faster then the left. I have been see as litter a 5% difference up to 25% difference in battery life. For example left would say 40% battery left and the right would say 15% battery left. But they do last for 5hrs for right and up to 7hrs for left. Also after 4 months with them they only last 3hrs now do not buy

author: dfgdsfdsgbdf
title: Exceeded expectation
content:
I wanted to try this newer style of earphones but I wasn't a fan of how Airpods looked. I looked at a lot of reviews on Youtube and these kept edging out Airpods. I was also a fan of the more discreet design. After trying them for myself I absolutely love them. Everything was better than I thought it would be. They don't leak sound. They innately cancel noise thanks to the in ear design(I was buying larger Headphones with a ANC switch so this was important for me). I also learned that they are.. err.. water proof(I bet you can guess where they ended up for me to learn this lol). The battery life is excellent as well. You basically store them in the charging base. The sound itself is impressive. I was really impressed with the solid amount of base these put out.

If you are looking to go small(the Beats Era is over lol) these are a great choice.

author: Jesse Tilman
title: Not for larger framed folks
content:
First and foremost, it's a pain trying to maintain consistent connection between these and my phone. I'm 6'5" and 270ish, I have a moderate gut and wide shoulders, which unfortunately makes it almost impossible to have my phone in my pocket *and* move around. When idle or when walking it's usually fine, but if I take these out for a run, or want to do chores around the house I have to fit my phone to a wrist mount or place it somewhere on high. They *definitely* sacrificed range on these.

That being said, the bass is nice and the highs and mids are crisp. Microphone works well, but seems to have intermittent connection issues for the above mentioned reasons. I didn't have to use any of the alternate sizes of earbud or wingtip to get a nice snug fit. You can tell them R&D'd the crap out of the twist-in design, you get a perfect seal everytime. The hear through function is basically necessary, even with only one earbud in, if you're gonna talk to someone. The use of touch controls is very welcome, as previous "true wireless" earbuds that had physical buttons always felt like plunging my ear whenever they were pressed. The tap is sometimes unresponsive, but you learn quickly that there's a sweet spot that needs to be hit. Still annoying that occasionally you have to try three or four times when out on a run, and it looks a little silly. I tend to use the pause and long press for assistant functions exclusively (it's not that hard to pull out your phone lol)

The fact that each bud can be used independently is really neat, but not without flaws. Occasionally when watching video one of the two buds will lag behind the other and there's a jarring distortion that you can't really ignore. Rarely, one of the buds will not connect when switching from single to dual, and won't respond until you put it back in the charging case and then take it back out. It's never persisted past that initial reset, so I'm not exactly taking any points off for that.

The battery life is adequate, the time to charge is not all that great but not at all bad. About 3 hours of nonstop use, at full volume; roughly an hour to charge the whole case, and roughly an hour to charge a bud back to full power. If you wanted to, it's perfectly feasible to use one at a time for ~12 hours of uninterrupted use. The "in ear, in use" sensor works fairly well, but lags quite a bit when taking the buds out before disabling the touch controls. It's more for battery preservation than anything else.

There's a lot of confusion online about the samsung app that goes along with these earbuds. *you do not need to install anything to get these to work*. The main reason one would *need* to install the samsung app is if you wanted to fine tune the use of the hear through function, which can be set once and then the app uninstalled.

at ~140 I'd put these a fair cut above the competition, Jabra's offerings are over priced and I dont even wanna start with apple earbuds (they're basically expensive trash by comparison). Despite the persistent issues I have with connection I wont be returning these, I consider that an unavoidable burden with tech this small. I would (and have) recommend(ed) these to a friend, but like it says in the title here, be aware if you are larger in frame.

author: Andre
title: Amazing!
content:
I just got these and I was NOT expecting them to be this good. I have my hair parted to the side and that means I can use one of them at a time and listen to music at work without anyone noticing at all because my hair covers my right ear. The sound quality really is good. Definitely not like stock earphones at all. Not as great as a full on headset, but you hardly notice any dip in quality and you get amazing portability with it. I can't comment on the battery life just yet but I will likely update this with that info after a week, although I have a portable charger just in case. Also, it ships with a USB-C cable in the box so don't worry about purchasing that seperately. Very satisfied with my purchase.

EDIT: May 20th; The battery life actually isn't that bad. I haven't had to recharge them with my portable charger even once. They charge in the case about 3 1/2 times for me and they each lasted about 5 hours, although I do only use one sometimes.
