author: Jeff S.
title: Unreliable connection and issues with battery.
content: Very poor connection and battery draining issues. After about 30 minutes of playback the connection has blips every 10 seconds or so that are annoying. Didn't have this issues in my jaybirds. Also the right earbuds drains batter even when in the case so the case loses battery quickly. The TouchPad is unreliable as well. I hope this is a lemon I got because I desperately wanted to like them

author: Scott H
title: It's all about the fit for your ears
content:
I bought a pair of Jabra Elite Active 65t first.  They kept falling out of my ears.  I replaced them with these and the Galaxy Buds fit much better.  I still prefer the fit of Bose "Stayhears," but the little fins on these are pretty good!

I was surprised to find that even though the overall weight of these and the Jabras are very close, it is distributed differently.  I tried many different aftermarket tips but these just work better for me and I feel less fatigue/irritation. It all depends on the fit for your ears.

The sound quality is decent once you find the right tips that isolate the sound in your ear canal.  Not nearly as good as wired earbuds.  My bose QC30s blueooth buds have significantly better sound but they require you wear the collar. These are much less constraining.

The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the very limited flexibility in what the earpads do when you tap them. You can't change the built-in function for single, double and triple taps.  All you can set is what happens when you touch and hold each earpad.

I wanted to be able to adjust volume up and down plus have a way to access Google Assistant/Siri.  Unfortunately, you can't do them all. If you pick volume up for one of the volume controls, the other is automatically set to volume down.  If you choose Siri, you can't do volume with the other ear, it has to be set to affect ambient sound, which isn't useful for me.

All in all, nice wireless earbuds at a better price than the Jabras.

author: B. Shutes
title: Decent Sound, Absysmal Call Quality
content:
I live in Nashville and we're no longer able to hold our mobile phones while driving.  I bought these - as a longtime Samsung / Android owner - to go with my Galaxy S10.

First of all, if you just want earbuds for the gym, these still aren't great.  I had them fall out of my ears while lifting on a couple occasions.  Getting the fit and placement makes a huge impact on sound and it took me a few tries to even get that right.

The call quality is just simply not there.  I have better luck on speakerphone in my Jeep than I do attempting conversation on the Galaxy Buds.  I live in a city.  It's not that I have bad cell reception.

Sorry, Samsung.  Try again.  In the meantime, it's back to the drawing board for me.

author: Tiffanee Kemper
title: Absolutely Love Them
content:
Been a Samsung user for years. I've recently taken an interest in other Samsung products besides smart phones. My Beats bluetooth headphones got lost so I went searching for a new pair and came across these. I purchased the white ones and I love them. The case is sleek, easy to use/charge and best of all, small! I keep the case in my pants pocket and it doesn't noticeably protrude. My favorite feature is the touch sensitive earbuds. I love that I can reach up and tap twice on my left ear bud and it changes the song.

The audio quality is fantastic. These babies block out EVERYTHING. Which is super awesome for me considering I'm a college student on campus and these help me cancel out noise and concentrate/zone into my own little world while studying and walking across campus. The call quality is amazing. The voices are clear and I've had no complaints from others on the quality of my calls.

The Galaxy Wearable App on my phone adds to the experience. You can customize the ambient sound so if you want to stay aware of your surroundings, you can set it to where the headphones will distinguish voices over background noise. You can also change the sound quality: bass booster, treble, etc among many other features.

Overall: Very pleased. I will HIGHLY recommend these to my other samsung user friends!

JUST BUY THEM ALREADY!!

author: Chris Williams
title: If you're new to the wireless earbud game, solid purchase! Upgrade worthy? Debatable.
content:
I've been HYPED about these earbuds since they were announced during Samsung's Galaxy Unpacked Event, and now I have them! I also own the predecessor to these, the Gear Icon X 2018s. I also have a pair of Jabra Elite 65Ts as well, I threw in some photos of those for a size comparison. I like these earbuds. Sound is good, definitely marginally better than the previous generation. The Galaxy Buds look better, they feel better, they're smaller, and the case charges wirelessly which is actually SUPER useful.

Now, I'm a Samsung FanBoy through-and-through, that being said, I think Samsung took a couple of steps backwards on a few things comparatively. The gestures are essentially the same as the previous gen except they got rid of swiping up and down on the earbuds for volume control. It's not the biggest deal since you can still set up the earbuds to give you volume control (based on long presses of each earbud) but now you have to choose between being able to control the volume from the earbuds or triggering ambient sound or voice commands, you cannot do both (from the earbuds at least), and that's kinda lame. Additionally, it seems like they've weakened the capability of Ambient Sound? On the previous gen I REALLY felt like I could hear my surroundings, within at least a ~10-15ft radius when Ambient Sound was active. With the Galaxy Buds that listening-radius feels significantly abbreviated for some reason? Additionally, most likely in the interest of shrinking the form factor, the Galaxy Buds no longer have their own onboard storage, so you can not store music on the buds themselves. That feature was super useful when you wanted to go for a run or workout but didn't necessarily want to have to bring your phone, fortunately not having it isn't a deal-breaker by any means.

I feel like these decisions might have been driven by the desire for more people to download Samsung's Galaxy Wear app, which is fine as a companion app. I feel as though with the Gear Icon X 2018s the goal was to help you not have to rely on your phone very much, if at all, where as the Galaxy Buds definitely make your phone a bit more necessary.

In summation, they're awesome wireless earbuds! They sound great, they look great, they're compact, wirelessly chargeable, LOUD, comfortable, and not uber expensive! Personally, I love features and options. Even if I'm not particularly going to use something often, I still prefer to have the option just in case and I would say objectively speaking, compared to the Gear Icon X 2018s, your options are definitely a bit lessened with these guys.

Upgrade worthy? Ehhhh, if you're like me and prefer options and the Gear Icon X 2018s fit you comfortably then I would say you're not missing out on anything more than a slightly modified design. If that's worth an upgrade to you, go for it! If not, I think your Gear Icon X 2018s are worth hanging onto for a while longer! Lastly, if you're new to the wireless earbud game, for $130 these are definitely a solid contender, especially considering the competition. Would recommend!

author: Jason G. Snow
title: Highly Satisfied
content: I used to hate the Ear Buds when they first came out. Had constant interference in downtown Chicago. I walk on a metal bridge, sound would cut out. At the gym on the fake turf, sound would cut out. After like 6 software updates, those problems have gone away and I can finally recommend this to anyone.

author: echoota
title: Well implemented except for poor reception
content: These earbuds had so much potential, great advanced features that I love, instance off when removing them, the slim carrying case, companion app with customizable features, touch interface, and several more.  They just can't hold a signal.  They're constantly dropping BT signal, even at times when I'm just a few feet away, and in line of site.  This behavior has been consistent; first on my Nexus 6p, and then after I upgraded to a Galaxy s10.

author: Romeo's
title: Comfort and fit are the best out of all True Wireless earbuds.
content: So before we continue know that I am comparing these to (Bose, Jabra, Raycons, and Tranya T3. So comfort and fit a solid 10! These fit and feel perfect! I can watch movies for hours and experience no ear fatigue. The Bose fit nice and are comfortable but unfortunately look ridiculous on your ears. I still think airpods look worse however the Bose are comfortable. Next Jabra's are nice however I did experience ear fatigue even with the smallest earpiece. Raycons looked and felt great however I could not get them to connect so they suck! Next the tranya T3 are a solid 9 on comfort and style. Now sound here the buds get a 8 from me. Bose are a 10, Jabra's get a 9 and Tranya T3 are at a 7 because the Bass is amazing! However the sound as not as clear at Samsungs buds. Battery life is also a plus. Today as I write this review I lost my left earbud for about 10 minutes! I had no idea where it was however with the find my buds app I was able to find it on the floor near my chair! I was so happy I was able to find it before leaving work. I hope this review helps. Remember these sound great and are the smallest and most comfortable earbuds currently on the market.

author: M. S. Raven
title: These are fantastic!
content:
I've been wanting wireless ear buds/headphones for years now. I just didn't trust the tech yet, or everything was way over priced. These are a decent price and are fantastic. They are not huge buds that stick out of your head making you look...special; and they are not like those small white ones that drip down and can only be held in place by ear wax. These have small rubber rims that hold them in place very well.

The sound quality is better than I was expecting. They are wireless, so you'll never get the quality of the regular overhead headphones, but they are as good as, or better than many wired earbuds I've used.

They connect to multiple devices without issue, which makes me so unbelievably happy! I can use these with my cell phone as well as my music device and it only takes seconds to switch back and forth.

I was a little put off by how easy it is to activate the touch controls - every time I stuck them in my ears or took them out, I turned on or off whatever I wanted to/had been listening to. But I have actually gotten used to this and now know how to put in and take them out without activating anything.

I've done a few calls with these as well and they are great. No issues with sound (from either end) or connection. They work better than anything else I've used in the past.

The wireless charger and charging are fantastic. I've never had them run out of battery, even though I use them most of the day at work to keep out office sounds. I don't know how many hours I use them, but maybe between 3 and 4? I've yet to run out of battery with regular daily use.

If you've been on the sidelines, unsure about buying wireless earbuds because of price or quality, these are (so far) a great product to get you started. I'm very pleased with them.

author: Corey
title: Love these headphones
content: I wear these all day at work. very comfortable after a few minutes you forget they are in. good quality sound and great not having any wires. i work on cars so its nice to not have any wires in my way or getting caught on anything. they sound great i only hear my music even over the sound of other people blasting radios and all the loud sounds of tools and cars throughout the shop. never had the batteries die on me, i usually put them in case to charge during lunch or at end of the day. and i leave the case charging while im using them

author: DonB368
title: Returned!
content: I wanted so bad to like these buds, but they are average at best, and have some problems. Two of the best features are the ability to wear either bud singularly, and be able to answer calls. (JLAB Air only allow calls from the right bud). And secondly, the fit. Between the 3 different size bud cushions, and the 2 different size fins, I was able to find a fit that was secure, and that I would have no problem wearing all day! Most other features are average, but about the same as other brand, cheaper buds (i.e. sound quality, battery life, quick pairing, charging case, etc.). The final straw for me was that the buds would lose connection when my phone was in my pocket, and I was outside walking. After researching, this is a common problem, and a complete deal breaker for me, because I use buds a lot when walking / working outdoors, and can not keep my phone in my hand! I have several different brand sub $60 ear buds, and not one of them has this problem! Because I have experienced less than stellar product support from Samsung with my Gear S3 Frontier watch battery life (a whole different problem with Samsung - Google it if interested), I didn't dare keep these beyond the return policy hoping for a fix! I caught myself accepting "average" performance from these buds because I wanted them to be good, but finally realized that if I was going to accept average performance, why do it for $149, when the JLAB Air buds are as good, and $100 cheaper!

author: Doreen
title: I love these
content:
I have always had issues with ear buds fitting comfortably so I normally like the kind that hang over the ear to avoid this issue.  I really wanted to give these a shot and I'm glad I did.  They are totally comfortable and they sound great.  I have had some issues with them staying completely connected to my phone when it's less than a foot away.  That could be my phone, though, so I'm not entirely sure.

The only thing to think about is how you're going to store them.  Unfortunately there aren't a lot of options in "external carriers" and there isn't a way to hook the charging case to anything.  If you take them out of your ears to speak to someone, for example, you'll want a place to put them so you don't lose them.

author: P. Tan
title: Finally wireless earbuds that work for me!
content: These are truly the best wireless earbuds ever! I’ve used them all! I’ve used big name, small name, & no name earbuds and these by far is the best in ear wireless earbuds ever! The price is not bad either! If your in the market to make an investment on some in ear wireless earbuds look no further. I workout just about almost everyday, and my workouts are never the same. I can cycle one day and strength train the next day and move as fast hard as much as I want and know they will still be sitting in my ear with confidence and not fall out like some other. Also I have an iPhone, these earbuds will work with iOS, but I am unable to use the app because that’s only for Android users, but no matter, it’s still badass.

author: Turner Emery
title: Not for small ears + Ambient mode is a hassle
content:
I'll start this off by saying that I really want to like these. When I heard about them and read the reviews, I thought they were exactly what I was looking for. Small, good battery life, and high quality sound. While it is each of those things, they unfortunately do not fit. The three sizes of ear tips that come with the buds are all around the same size, and it was actually difficult to tell the smalls from the mediums at first glance. The problem stems from the size of the speaker under the tip. It alone is about 5 mm, which when the tips are put on, results in it being a very tight fit. My ear holes are very narrow and after about 1/2 hour wearing these, they start to ache. At one point I left them in for about 2 hours and hadn't adjusted them, and when I went to take them out my ears were extremely sore and it felt like someone was pinching them with pliers. I tried comply foam tips, but the rubber "core" was still big enough to be putting an uncomfortable amount of pressure on my ears. This likely doesn't apply to a lot of people, but if you have small ears, you should probably look elsewhere.

The sound quality is pretty good, although the bass seems a little weak given the price. Also, I don't love that they are so dependent on the equalizer in the app to sound good. The sound without the equalizer on is honestly pitiful. I have an android, so for use with my phone it's alright, but it's just a hassle. The headphones shouldn't be so dependent on an app.

The software also has some other annoying problems, like the fact that the ambient sound mode automatically turns off upon removing 1 bud. I like to have the ambient mode on so I can hear if someone comes to talk to me at work, but I am not going to leave them while speaking to the person. If I take even one bud out, the ambient mode get turned off, and I need to go back into the app to turn it on again. That's another thing: the hold to turn on ambient mode only triggers a temporary ambient mode. I would have much rather had it be a toggle of the ambient mode, or at least have the option. Also, having ambient mode on adds a constant static sound, making me wish there was a way to set a threshold for how loud something has to be to come through. Overall the ambient mode seems very poorly integrated, almost like it was added as an after thought.

Something that I do like that you don't see that often is that there is no main bud. I can alternate between the buds at will and put one back on to charge. They are also very attractive and I like they way they look when I'm wearing them.

As a whole, I don't see these being worth the $130 as is. If you can get them for <$90, and you don't have very small ears, I'd say they are probably worth the purchase. For me though, they just don't seem worth it. One of the points in getting wireless buds is to have a seamless experience, and having to take them out every 20 minutes to let my ears rest, and then needing to turn ambient mod back on completely defeats the purpose.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good for first couple weeks but then...
content:
The product was okay for the first couple weeks, but about three weeks in, my left earphone just started making a loud static noise and wouldn’t stop.
Apparently it’s a known bug.
They said the solution is to reset the earphones using the app, but the app is only available on android devices and I use these on my iPhone.

Pros:
- great fit
- personally I like the way they look, very minimal and do not pop out of ear much

Cons:
- ambeient noise control not available unless u have an android device. This was very disappointing because it advertised the feature heavily. Pretty strange that you can’t activate a bunch of features that are in the hardware because u don’t have the app for it.
- broke within a month
- sound quality not really impressive.
- mic not very clear

author: Angel Salgado
title: Great Buds DONT LEAVE IN WASHER
content:
Great buds. Noise cancellation is not all too great, but once you turn the music loud enough, noise will be blocked. When these first arrived, my right ear would feel fatigue after about 10 min. After 2 days of constant use, my ears got used to them. The only issue I am now facing is random cutoff of sound. Sound sometimes will start to mess up when phone is in pocket. Another bad thing if you take out one bud and don't put it back in the case, then the sound will cut off from the bud in your ear. Overall, these are great for the price.

UPDATE: A day after I wrote this review, they ended up in the washer. On Friday the 13th. What a coincidence. Left bud is completely toast. Case is fine, but the right bud get hot when charged and the sound is muffled. The battery is also messed up. Please don't forget to take them out of your pocket.

author: Johnny
title: Good but not perfect
content:
Pros:
-Good sound quality (Don't expect hi end audio from any pair of earbuds but they do sound pretty good)
-Great battery life
-Comfortable
-No lag when watching video (youtube)
-Compact charging case with wireless charging

Cons:
-The volume levels could have better adjustment. (Volume 3 is too loud and volume 2 is a bit soft. Can we get a volume 2.5?)
-Doesn't work well with my kindle. For some reason the audio doesn't stay in sync in both ears. Luckily I can use just one earbud at a time. Also the tap and hold to adjust volume doesn't work like on my phone.

author: Ethan McCloud
title: Superb Noise Canceling Awesome Sound
content: To date there is not a single thing I can complain about these headphones, aside from a few rare technical difficulties that would occur. Like random times when it takes a few attempts to sync with the phone but this may only happen once out of a hundred uses. Also, sometimes the quality of my voice seems to make people have a hard time hearing me but this is only when I am in a noisy environment so take that as you will. Besides that, these offer an awesome sound that provide amazing noice canceling that I have not experienced before with in ear headphones. From mowing the lawn to vacuuming inside the house, I could barely hear either noise when using these. You also have the feature to allow ambient noise to hear your surroundings while enjoying these headphones which was a nice plus when you're jogging or are in an area where hearing your surroundings is important. All in all, the convenience of being able to pull these out of there case and simply put them into your ear to activate the bluetooth feature is a luxury I can not go without now. 5/5

author: adeel jamal
title: Galaxy Buds Over AirPods 2 Anyday!
content: These Galaxy Buds are definitely worth the price tag of $129.99. Looking at the airpods you don't get nothing near what you get from the Galaxy Buds for $160. The Airpods 2 cant even compete either for $200. I would get the Galaxy Buds over any Airpod anyday. If I could ask for one thing they could add to the Galaxy Buds is more thump with the bass the bass is more like sound bass where you can hear the bass but not feel it.

author: Miley Ng
title: Amazon might had sold me a refurbished headphones at full price
content:
Please save yourself the headache and purchase these galaxy buds from the actual Samsung website. The quality of these had phones are the worse. My friends are always telling me that they can't hear me and that I sound muffled. I just thought maybe Samsung did not do a good job in developing these buds.

However, I lost one ear piece last week and decided to buy a different pair. This time, I bought my second Samsung Galaxy Buds from Samsung . com AND it was major different. The sound quality and the battery life is different! My friends no longer complain how muffled I sound. Each bud also last me 7 hours compared to the 3 hours of the Galaxy Buds from Amazon.

Not so happy and won't be buying any expensive product on Amazon anymore.

author: Lucas
title: LOVE THEM
content: I absolutely love the galaxy buds. I gave the buds a 5 star because the are perfect small portable and last a long time between charges I'm averaging around 12-13 hours total play back and that's insane for how small these things are. The are able to be charged either with a charging cable or wirelessly and both work well.. the size and weight of the actual earbud is perfect it's super light so once it in the ear its almost unnoticeable they do cancel most noise and do offer an ambient sound setting to help keep you alert to your surroundings but I have found that feature is not as good as I was expecting. The sound from these is good for an earbud but it's just not fair to compare these to a pair of high quality/studio headphones. The bass is impressive for the size but unfortunately the ear buds do not seem to get super loud even turned up the entire way they are loud but not deafening I am using these on my galaxy s10+ as well as my Acer Laptop with all eq settings to off.

author: MightyInks
title: They Messed up greatly with the Mic
content:
I been expecting these since they were announced and was super excited about them. I have everything smart at home and feels awesome holding my bud to give commands.

While I love pretty much everything about these gotta say they honestly messed up with the mic. I tried everything, I changed all the tips and wings trying to have them at different angles to see if the mic would improve but no. I spend hours on the phone everyday day and everyone told me I sounded muffled. I have an Anker Bluetooth that I use all day long and never had this issue.

It is extremely annoying having to repeat everything because people can NOT understand you at all. This issue gets worse when there's noice. For music listen they are great but for the main thing that is talking on the phone they are pretty much absolutely useless.

author: M
title: Excellent design. Poor bass response.
content:
I got these Galaxy Buds to use with my iPhone, because Airpods unfortunately don't fit my ears.

I was quite impressed as I unwrapped the beautiful looking box. The design of the packaging, the charging case and the buds themselves is excellent. Pairing even with a non-Samsung phone is quick and easy, and putting the buds in is intuitive. I was pretty happy with my new purchase so far. They look and feel great.

However, once I started playing some music through them is when the disappointment hit. These buds (at least the specific ones I received) are completely unable to reproduce bass. Sounds in the highs and mids are decently represented, even higher bass notes sound pretty good, but once you get to the lowest frequencies, there's just nothing. I tried the various accessories to improve the fit but nothing improved the frequency response. Even the various cheap wired earbuds I have do way better reproducing the full spectrum of music. I don't know why some people are raving about the sound quality of these things. Did I get dud buds? Anyway, I will be returning them and hoping for a better sounding product with equally good design to come along some day.

author: Oliver
title: Finally some airbuds I can recommend.
content: I can't believe how many crappy products are out there with good reviews. Until now I haven't found anything that compares to the quality of the airpods. These are a great price, great sound a little more base then the airpods and I like the noise isolation. I was looking for some that I could wear in noisy places to block out sound. Even doing yard work with a mower or weed wacker going these are nice so you don't have to blast the music to drown out the outside noise. They're light and comfortable and the battery life is fantastic. I'm one who doesn't care about case battery life I want listening battery life. What good are buds that you can't listen to all day?  I haven't had an drops or that pain in the a$$ one ear bud drop while working out.  I'd recommend these to anyone who wants a great set of buds at a great price.

author: RAINEBO
title: Not worth the price
content:
For playing music these earbuds are wonderful and the fit  is great as far as using them for talking they're not so good they are a hit or miss.

1. Can't answer calls during the announcement of the caller a delay occurs after attempting to answer the call and you are disconnected.
2. My voice was not always clear when used for calls people said I sound muffled or very low.
3. Volume control will not work while talking to a caller the buds will give a strange sound and it will mute the call on your end and the caller cannot hear you. However the volume control works great when playing music only.
4. Sometimes the earbuds will cut out when bending down even if you have the phone in your pocket.
5. The Ambient sound works best inside.

author: Tyler H.
title: Most underrated feature: ear size customization
content:
I'll start with the headline...
The out of the box rubber fitting fit my ears great and for the last week I havent had any uncomfortably or issues. But this morning I decided to see how the other rubber fittings felt in my ears and WOW....

All 3 configurations 'fit' my ear; but I found that the medium inner ear and the small 'wing tip' piece fit my ears PERFECTLY. Wow I cant believe I was wearing them wrong this whole time...

Ratings:

Sound quality: #2
The sound quality is 2nd only to Bose, for $70 less.

Looks: #1
This is obviously opinion based but because of features like the case style, actual bud looks, and they dont have the douche-vibes that you get with wearing apple airpods thus making the Galaxy Buds the best option.

Customization: #1
If you have a galaxy phone...forget it man the customization of the first gen Galaxy Buds is already light years above the competition.

Features: #1
Wireless charging, touch pad on ear buds, command customization, sound customization, EAR PIECE CUSTOMIZATION

Value: #1
$70 less than Bose, $30 less than airpods and far more features.

-Galaxy Buds are the reason I FINALLY got rid of my LAST apple product, airpods 🤮🤮🗑🗑

author: Randy
title: Update: Returned 1st time, 2nd set stellar!
content: Experienced left bud stuttering with the first pair, 2nd set is perfecto!  Had to use large ear tips to seal properly but once I did the sound of these is unbelievable.  I also own the very good Jabra 65t active and the Galaxy Buds have quickly become my favorite.  I can wear these hours on end with no discomfort and these stay in my ears.  The Jabra's are not quite as comfy and I can't stop the right ear bud from falling out when I'm active.  The Galaxy Buds touch controls are not as slick as Jabra's though.  Jabra's work every time and their application offers a 5 band eq.  I like to set the Galaxy Buds presets to dynamic to get the best sound.  The Galaxy Buds having a case that allows wireless charging and use of the newer C type USB connector is very nice.  In spite of their weak points I'm giving these 5 stars due to sound quality, all day comfort and staying in the ear.  Note:  I didn't extensively test them for call quality but I can tell you that calls worked great and folks on the other end said they could hear me just fine.  I bought these for music though, not call capability.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Opening the charge case puts it in pairing mode. Fully charge on first use.
content:
I've owned the previous Gear IconX and can safely say the sound quality which has been tuned by their AKG subsidiary has definitely improved it.

Bluetooth 5.0 gives it a snappy connection speed.

It fits more snuggly in my ear, it also comes with 3 different sized ear tips, and two different size wingtips.

The size of them will almost leave you in awe, the charging case is smaller and the buds are smaller.

The Touch controls still feel the same compared to the last one, albeit somewhat a bit more responsive - just a tiny bit.

Only cons are that it is NOT going to last long in water, I mean you can assume so from other reviews. It IS sweat resistant, of course.

Oh, and also it doesn't have on-board storage.

Other than that, it's an overall improvement.

author: Kar_07
title: Wireless earbuds that have good sound quality
content:
Had been using the Galaxy Buds for few weeks now, and they are good. Having the wireless charging is a best option as now there is no need for charger for the earbuds when they can be wirelessly charged by the Samsung S10+.

The Wearable app gives much further control into seeing the sound Equalizer types and Ambient Sound options and Touchpad controls on the Buds with an option to set a custom control.

Setup of buds is quite simple and easy to setup, just opening the case near a Samsung Phone prompts user to set up the Galaxy Buds.

Good feature is that each bud can be used independent of the other which is always good when working at office where one headphone suffices.

But upon talking about what is missing, there is no option to see how much charge the case holds at a moment so it would be all guesswork as to when to charge the case.

Upon frequent use, noticed that each bud lasts for about hour and a half or so, and case charges them 2-3 times.

Size of the Galaxy Buds remains as same as the Gear Icon X, but the features have improved a lot, including the connectivity and charge time. Also the white color is really good. Earbuds are detected as put in and instantly shows the Connected message on phone and shows the previous volume level that was set.

When updating software on earbuds, it still requires both earbuds to be connected and it takes over 2 monites to update 1mb and earbuds are useless during that time so was disappointed in that.

All in all, a really good earbud with good Equalizer options and easy control trackpad

Pros:
Compact size
Individual earbud usage
Wireless Charging

Cons:
No option to check Case battery
Long update times

author: Kev DeLeon
title: These Galaxy Buds are purely amazing.
content:
This is my first review, and I apologize for the length. If you read it, you may gain some insight on the Galaxy Buds :) I was compelled to do this review because of how Amazon’s customer service > Samsung’s “customer service” and for how great this product truly is. I preordered my S10+ only to be one of the many who were unlucky enough to not get it included with the phone, and would subsequently have to wait "15 days for the promotional $130 gift card only for usage on Samsung.com” ..not sure if I will receive that or not because the promotional support is extremely subpar for such a revolutionizing smart phone like the Samsung Galaxy S10+; so, I decided to order it on Amazon and will use the $130 for a Micro SD or some other accessories, if I get it.
Amazon... you continue to amaze me :) I ordered these Galaxy Buds on Wednesday, 03/13/19 with a an originally scheduled delivery range from 04/05/19-04/29/19. THESE BUDS ARRIVED 3 DAYS LATER ON Saturday, 03/16/19. WHAAATT?? Thank you, Amazon!!! Now THAT is quality service for these quality Galaxy Buds!
The new 2019 Galaxy Buds are purely amazing.
The highs are great; I personally have the sound toggled to "Bass Boost" on the Galaxy Wearable app and the sound is utter bliss. I have a pair of "noise-canceling" Bose QuietComfort 35 II, and the sound quality on these Galaxy Buds definitely compare with “elite” brands because of its quality. I find these Buds to be on an even keel as far as sound quality with a variety of genres in the “Bass Boost” mode: rap, rock, country, reggaeton, opera, and even classical all sound great with these Buds. Trust me, I have songs in my playlist that have different ranged bass lines, I managed to fit 2 12” Rockford Fosgate subwoofers in my Subaru BRZ, and these Buds’ sound quality did not diminish and did not distort even with the heavy bass line usage. I normally use headphones to listen to classical music while I am studying, doing a project for work, or just like everyone else- shell off from the outer world. As a test, the Buds were able to "cancel" the screech of the BART cars when I was riding BART earlier while the volume was at 75% to full volume, something the Bose QC 35 II sadly could not do despite its "noise-canceling” capabilities. (BART is an extremely loud, outdated train transit system in the SF Bay Area).
Not sure why the finish on the exposed part of the Buds is glossy, it would have been better off as a matte finish because it is bound to get oily fingerprints all over it. The “Touchpad” is not as responsive and comfortable as I would like. It is going to take some time to get used to because when one taps on the touchpad, to play/pause/skip it kind of drives the silicone padding into your ear drum- and is somewhat deafening with the taps. The touchpads can be customized to do voice command, quickly adjust ambient sound, or volume up/down with a touch and hold gesture. The ambient sound is an interesting feature to use, especially when someone needs to be alert with their surroundings.
In sum, the delivery was just like ordering anything with Amazon Prime, despite the projected delivery being 3-6 weeks from now. The Galaxy Buds can compare with “noise-canceling” rated headphone despite not being rated to cancel out noise. The sound quality is purely amazing with great highs and lows that do not distort no matter how heavy the bass line is. The finish is glossy, but who cares it’s going to be in your ears! The Touchpad
GET THESE BUDS NOW!!!!

author: Jairo Gomez
title: great wireless earbuds
content:
These are amazing. Great sound quality (especially since i use them with a galaxy phone), battery  lasts all day, durable, and the charging case is feels durable. At first it was a but uncomfortable  but i did get used to them and now they feel good and don't usually fall out. I've tried all three of the fins that came with the earbuds but i went back to the medium size fins. In cases when I have lost track on them, I can find them thanks to a feature where the earbuds make a loud chirping sound (I think its only  accessible with a Samsung device but I am not sure)

overall, great earbuds, took some getting used to, battery life long enough to last me all day (with some charging in the case) and will usually stay in my ear.

author: AppLogic
title: An excellent, well-rounded pair of earbuds
content:
Just to get some stuff out of the way, I'm using these with my Galaxy S8+, and I typically only use headphones for like an hour at a time, so I cant speak to the long term use battery life.

I have tried many bluetooth earbuds, both wired and true wireless, and these take the cake. I guess what surprised me the most is that these earbuds are unsurprising? They do everything they say they will do, and they do it fairly well.

Sound quality: Good, completely satisfactory, but not amazing. Which is fine considering their size and weight. Pretty flat frequency response, but the bass can be nice and punchy if you get it fitted right.

Battery life: Excellent, never had a problem or even come close to draining the battery. But like I said, my longest typical use is a 1 hour workout. Wireless charging is excellent, but not insanely snappy. Perfect for tossing your earbuds on your desk when you go to bed and picking them up in the morning.

Fit: Amazing. Never even comes close to coming out, better than any other headphones I've ever used, wired or not! Very comfortable and light, never caused me any problems, even during heavy running.

My personal favorite category, VIDEO PLAYBACK. I have hated every true wireless earbud I've tried because of awful latency between the video playback and the audio. These earbuds have practically no noticeable latency! It's awesome. However, I have been told that non-Samsung devices tend to have mixed results with this.

Durability: So far, so good! I have sweated thoroughly with these on, and dropped them a good couple times (the case too) and they seem to be fine. If you drop them, there is a 90% chance that the lid will open and the earbuds will fly out, but this doesn't seem to cause too much damage.

And the rub, software: Not great. Yet. It works, but I have encountered an irritating issue. Like many earbuds, these have a volume level separate from your phone's volume. This can only be easily changed if you set the touchpads on each earbud to adjust their volume. Which means you cant use the touchpads for other things like the ambient sound mode or to summon your voice assistant. Software could definitely be better.

If you have any sound quality issues, my suggestion is to play around with the phone and headset volumes. I personally crank up the earbuds all the way, then adjust listening volume with the phone.

All in all, these have satisfied a very picky person who hated all the other true wireless earbuds he tried.

author: J. fox
title: Greet comfort, sleek styling,  decent sound
content:
I've been looking for a good pair of wireless earbuds for the gym for a while.  I tried the B&O's and though they sounded great they were extremely uncomfortable and stuck out of my ears  way too far.

I'm happy to say that the Samsung's are very comfortable and sleek.  I can wear these for 90 minutes plus with very little discomfort.  They stay in my ears while working out too!  Once in a while I have to twist them back into place but not too often.

The sound quality is ok.  It's definitely not as good as the B&O but those are more than twice the price.  These are tuned to favor the highs for sure, and at first sounded too harsh.  But either I got used to them or they are now broken in, they don't bother my ears anymore.

As far as connectivity goes they have yet to drop out or disconnect.  They pair up quickly with my phone and laptop, and the app is easy to use.

Overall I'm happy with my purchase and if you're on the fence or thinking of getting these, I recommend that you try them.

author: Richard E
title: Galaxy Buds: Easy Enough and Great Features
content:
The Galaxy Buds are great and easy to use. The two biggest pros of the Buds are the truly wireless nature of the Buds and the in-ear perfect fit. The idea of not having to worry about cables is an obvious feature of the Buds and boy is it great! That fact plus the comfortableness of the Buds makes this a good investment.

Pro: Feel. The fit/feel of the Buds is very comfortable and comes with adjustable parts to change the wingtip or eartip size. Upon first trying on the Buds the wingtip clips into your ear so that they do not fall out easily. The wingtip edge makes sure that it fits snug into your ear- perfect for working out or if you are nervous about the Buds falling out. If you are not comfortable with the feel of the Buds, you can simply change the sizing with the interchangeable eartips and wingtip- or if you don’t want the wingtip there are tips without the wings.

Pro: Simple Use. After pairing the Galaxy Buds and using them for a while, one of the coolest features of the Buds is the touch navigation of the Buds. Tapping once on the Buds will pause whatever you are listening to. Other navigational options are: Play, volume control, and answering calls. Also, the Buds can sense when you take them out of your ear and they automatically pause and will resume upon placing back into your ear. If you don’t like the settings for the touch menu it can be changed on the app. The other simple use is the charging. It uses the same USBC charger as the newer Samsung phones and is compatible with wireless charging pads. I haven’t had to charge them much- the battery life has lasted me pretty long stretches.

Pro: Easy Pairing. The Galaxy Buds are Bluetooth enabled and paired with my Samsung Galaxy phone easily. It is set up through the Galaxy Wearable app, (which was recently updated to include a hub area for the headphones). This is the same app that connects to the Gear watch, so if you already have it then great. If not, you can easily download it from the app store. Through the Galaxy Wearable app you can check the battery percentage of the Buds, adjust the sound through an equalizer, change what the touchpad responses are, manage notifications, a “find my earbuds option, and (my favorite) the ambient sound option. The ambient sound option allows you to hear your surrounding while you play audio through the Buds. This is perfect for situations where you want to listen to music but may need to hear your surroundings- like going on a run outside but wanting to hear your surroundings for safety reasons.

Con: Although the ambient sound option is a convenient mode to use it has its cons. The ambient sounds option makes the volume low and turning up the volume all the way does not seem to help. Also, during days when it is windy, you hear the wind more than you hear the music. The ambient sound mode is a great option to use but Samsung needs to improve the sound quality.

Pro: Good Use For library. I primarily used the Buds in the library, and they are perfect for college students looking to tune out their surroundings during studying. The ambient sound mode actually worked great here. I was able to concentrate on studying while having the volume low and still being able to hear my surroundings.

Overall, the Galaxy Buds have a great feel, are easy to use and pair, and have quite a lot of customization options. I recommend for the price!

author: Doyle
title: Earbuds constantly go out of sync
content:
Earbuds are comfortable and have decent battery life, sound quality is worse than what I was led to believe from some reviews here. But that was manageable - what is not is the earbuds constantly go out of sync with each other when using them on my laptop. The left earbud is about 0.5-1 second ahead of my right earbud, and happens without warning when I'm watching shows or youtube. They have no sync problems when I used them with my Galaxy s7 phone, but will go out of sync every few minutes on the laptop.

I'm using a new Dell laptop and have reinstalled drivers on my computer + tried resetting the earbuds, but the problem persists. Other truly wireless earbuds I've used had no problems (Jabra Elite 65t, Anker Soundcore, Master & Dynamic) so I know it's not my laptop. Googling the out-of-sync issue revealed that this is a pretty common problem too. So while I enjoyed these earbuds and had no problems with the not-great audio since the price was lower than most high-end earbuds, I can't recommmend these.

author: BoomRoasted
title: Decent Wireless Headphone Solution. Horrible Customer Service Policies
content:
Bought these and was quite happy with the easy use, pairing, and functions within. Prior to the event causing me to contact customer service, I would have rated these at 4 stars.

About a month after purchasing these, I was on a hike in some mountainous trails in Colorado. While placing the charging pill, with the earbuds inside, in my pocket, the pill slipped an hit the ground. When the pill is ever dropped, the headphones go flying 3+ ft. Well both the headphones and charging case fell into rock crevices around us. We were able to find the charging case and one headphone, but unable to find the other. What we recovered still work, pair, and charge just fine (just with one headphone). I tried to contact Samsung Support on multiple occasions to see about getting a replacement bud for the one I lost. SURPRISE: Samsung refused to work me on getting a replacement. I was told that there was no way to get (and I even asked specifically about purchasing one) a replacement. I couldn't send them what I have, then pay the difference (as I'm sure they can refurbish mine and/or provide me a refurbished bud and just pair it with mine). No options, simply told "You have to buy another pair". For a device that essentially explodes into its pieces when dropped from 3 feet, being unable to request or replace an individual component seems like a money-grabbing business policy instead of working with customers willing to pay for the missing piece.

author: vlafmme
title: Good choice for iPhone users too.
content:
As of now there is no Samsung Wearable app in the Apple world, so we miss out on the effect which amplifies your surroundings, and perhaps a few other things too. I don’t mind at all though. I wanted secure earbuds with good quality sound and that’s what these are. You can’t really hear your surroundings, which can be a good or bad thing. As soon as I remove them from the charging case, they seamlessly connect to my phone and all I have to do is press play. The touch controls work well.
I primarily listen to music with acoustic instruments and I am very impressed with the sound quality on that front. The bass is satisfying for me, that being said, I don’t listen to EDM. Talking on the phone works well and the people on the other line say they can hear me very clearly.

author: Joshua Madl
title: Best earbuds on the market
content: I have used wireless headphones before, but these are the first wireless earbuds I've ever used. After doing some research I decided to get these. It was a fabulous choice. The sound quality is well balanced and the sound cancellation is very good as well, thanks to the way the buds fit in your ear. Additionally the touchpad on the side works well and the customization is handy. The charging case is a convenient USB C and charges quickly. I used these buds with a Google pixel 3 and the Bluetooth connection has worked well. They connect automatically when you put them in your ear, after initial pairing.

author: Randy Savage
title: Solid product.
content:
Very happy. I was nervous they'd be oversized like the Bose Soundsport (still an excellent product), not at all. The case is small and fits easily in your pocket and the buds themselves are perfectly sized and feel great.

Easy to pair. Easier to connect after initial pairing.

Sound quality is good and you can fine tune it in the wearables app.

The only thing I didn't like was the touchpad, the double/triple tap takes some practice.

author: jorge
title: Bad connection issue.
content: I bought these when they first came out I was excited for them and to be honest they where a disappointment. They work fin for about 10 minutes then they start to studder while the phone is in my pocket. I'll pull out the phone and it works fine as soon as I put the phone back in my pocket it studders utter disappointment do not buy these till they fix the connection issue. They are great when they actually work.

author: Joe
title: Not a bad attempt, but suffers from some serious flaws.
content:
Update 04/06/19: After a 5 mile run today I have chosen to return these. I have used them several times over the past week. When they work they are nice, they work fine if I use them at work or around the house, but if I'm running or hiking they de-sync from each other and stutter CONSTANTLY. They are completely unusable and infuriating. They have been updated by Samsung, but still the connection problems persist. Hopefully Samsung can fix these problems in the future, but until then I'm not happy about paying top shelf prices for a beta test. I'm going back to my $20 Chinese earbuds that actually WORK.

I received my Galaxy Buds last Friday the 29th. I was excited to receive them as  I use earbuds often when working out or just walking around and the $20 set of Chinese earbuds I had been using worked reasonably well but I wanted to splurge a little on some really nice truly wireless earbuds.

Initial thoughts:

Aesthetically they are very nice, they don't hang out of your ears, really it just looks like you are wearing earplugs or something. They fit comfortably in the ears, they come with a variety of rubber parts of various sizes so you can really dial in the fit. Most importantly they sort of "lock in" to your ears. That is a feature that I cannot live without. There's nothing I hate more than earbuds falling out when you are just getting into a run.

I used them around the house over the weekend. Buds in, phone sitting on my desk or sometimes in my pocket and they worked fine. The sound is decent. I'm no audiophile but I've used good earbuds and bad ones and these definitely fall into the good category. The app is great, the charging case is convenient and easy to use, and the ambient sound "enhancement" works surprisingly well.

Now for the downside:

I took the Buds out for a little hike today, nothing serious. Phone in my pocket. At first they worked fine, but as the hike went on they started cutting out intermittently. Sometimes one, sometimes the other, sometimes they were out of sync with each other. I tried disconnecting them, turning bluetooth on and off, even messing with audio settings. I tried holding the phone, putting it in a different pocket, no matter what I tried it would only help the problem for a few seconds at most. By the time I was nearing the end of the trail the earbuds were almost unusable cutting out and stuttering constantly.

I had a similar problem with a pair of the Chinese bluetooth earbuds and I had to return them for a replacement, but now the current pair I have work flawlessly. I'll try the Galaxy Buds again and update my review, but if this continues and the connectivity is really worse than a $20 pair of earbuds I can't recommend these to anyone.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Use the correct eartip adaptor!!!
content: Out of the box, into my ears and the sound was TERRIBLE (like AM radio bad) Tinny and zero bass. They felt comfortable, so I did not pay attention to the eartip adapter size. I was ready to return them until I read someone else's post about using a larger adapter - I tried it and WOW, night and day difference! The sound quality is actually pretty good - not excellent, but pretty good. (I'm sure you can spend your way to excellent, but for the price these are decent). It's just strange that the bass "leaks out" if there is not a good seal in your ear.

author: Paul M.
title: Very disappointed
content: I have been a Samsung man since the note 5 I now have the note 8. I wanted to stay with all samsung so I bought the so called best and newest Samsung had to offer. 1st the sound is not great. It's just ok. I read all the comments talked to customer service and tried everything but they dont play loud enough. The one thing that did help was changing to a larger tip. That made it a little better than just ok. I got these on the 8th and on the 14th the left earbud will not connect. SMH.

author: jamin
title: Had them for only 3 hours and I have problems already.
content:
first i want to say the sound quality is great in my opinion...... that's it.

Now straight to the point.  I recieved these buds around 2pm I started using them Immediately, when I was on the phone it hung up on the caller twice 5pm today the right ear bud disconnected on me and will now reconnect I charged and still won't reconnect the right ear bud is done I didn't get a chance to use the buds at it's full potential... I'm disappointed and want my money back.

author: John Z.
title: Awesome Buds, highly recommend
content:
Audio: Not punchy bass like airpods, Overall sound quality is very very good for the average music listener.
Material: Solid build quality, metal mesh inside the earpiece. Case is solid and holds the buds in place.
Look Fit: includes different tips and are very comfy. Have ran about 8 miles with them and had 0 issues with them getting loose or falling out.
Connection: The only issue i found was when my phone was juggling between these and my car's bluetooth. 0 problems with them in my pocket. You can get at least 25 feet from the phone without any connection degrade.
Instantly pairs when you open the case. Open the case, throw them in and tap the side and boom: wireless music.

Overall: I highly recommend if you are looking for some awesome wireless buds whether its for working out or casual use, these buds are sleek, last a long time and sound great and work well. 9/10

Note: these are my first wireless headphones ( other than AKG N60 or whatever). I used a friend's airpods for about 30 seconds as a comparison before i had my GBs

author: TimO
title: Great size, shape, & fit - poor connection and call quality
content:
The good
-These fit great in your ears, do not fall out,  have nice sound for small ear buds, and battery life is pretty good, especially considering the added charge time with the case.

The bad
-Frequent sound breakage between the two ear buds,  terrible call quality. Several people told me it sounds like I'm speaking in to a tin can with a sock in my mouth. Unfortunately software upgrades and tweaking settings in the app did not help this at all. I also frequently encountered the dreaded 'robo-voice' along with poor connection quality with the buds.

Was excited for these things,  however, I had to return them as I kept running in to issues with sound and call quality.

author: L.M.
title: Excellent
content:
What a fantastic product from Samsung. These are insanely comfortable - I rarely have problems even after wearing these for literally 12+ hours a day. I can sleep with these in and not even notice they're there.

Excellent comfort aside, the sound quality is pretty good, definitely on the level of Airpods and probably a step above. Bass is definitely not as good as it could be, but it's more than fine and mids/highs are clear and defined. The perfect product for my needs, and a great choice for most people, especially if you don't want to support Apple and its predatory business practices.

author: 3dogs&a-girl
title: Does NOT Stay in Ear, Uncomfortable
content:
The sound quality on these is okay but not as good as I'd expect for expensive earbuds. The noise cancellation is weak. I'm not a sound snob though, so I probably would have kept these buds had they been more comfortable.

I have small ears, and they were simply too big. After a while, my ears would ache from the pressure on the upper section of my ear (where the soft piece sits). I tried both the hook and non-hook style, and both hurt.

The final kicker was the first time I used these I took my dog for a walk. Mind you, it was not a run, so no real bouncing. At one point, I jogged to cross a street, and my left bud fell out. I noticed within a block, retraced my steps, and found it, but that should never happen. I can't afford to lose a $160 pair of buds. These are supposed to stay put, and they didn't in my ears. I can't even imagine running with them.

I sent them back. These were not a win for me.

author: Jessica
title: iPhone user. These are worth the buy! (Pro/Cons)
content:
I am always VERY skeptical and do lots of research before ordering a new pair of headphones. I saw a lot of great reviews and a lot of bad reviews on these.

I was looking to get a pair of Samsung headphones to connect to my TV, since  Samsung SmartTV’s only allow you to connect Samsung Bluetooth headphones, no other brands. I have an iPhone (and a lot of other Apple devices), so I didn’t want to spend this much money on something that would ONLY work with my TV, but not my phone. Luckily, they work on any device and sound great!

*These are just my personal opinions, but I’m going to break down some pros and cons:

Pros
-They sounds great
-They work with any device
-They’re extremely comfortable in my ears, which is a first for me with any earbuds (AirPods are absolutely impossible for me to wear because they hurt so badly and fall right out)
-They come with several different options for the little tips that go on them to make them more comfortable in-ear
-They’re small, but not so small that I would lose them easily
-They stay in when I’m walking, running, etc.
-They will cancel out just about ANY sound around you
-There’s Touch Pads on each bud that allow you to pause, play, play next track, play previous track, and activate Siri/Bixby
-Battery life on the buds is actually pretty great, and the charging case will charge them completely a few times before needing charged itself

Cons
-Connecting to devices that are NOT Samsung devices can be tedious at times (especially if you want to connect to a specific device but have connected them to several already, or if you’re connecting them to a new device)
-The Ambient Aware Mode, Equalizer, and Auto-sync features are AMAZING, but ONLY available on Android-based devices!
-Same with being able to change what the touchpad does on each bud. Being able to change long-press on the touchpad from Siri to Volume Up/Down is also an exclusive to Android-based devices, which really bothers me because I’d LOVE to be able to turn the volume up/down from the buds!
(I tested these Samsung-exclusive features out on my mom’s Samsung S9+ and I have to say that these features are absolutely amazing and it’s VERY disappointing that they have them locked!)

As you can see, my pros list far outnumbers my cons. Although the cons are minimal, they are pretty big cons for me. The Ambient Aware Mode and other Samsung/Android-exclusive features are incredible. Really wish they’d allow other devices to use those features, but these earbuds are 100% worth the price tag to me, even without those features.

I guess it’s just a personal preference, but I never thought I’d find a pair of headphones/earbuds I liked more than my trusty old Bose SoundSport headphones. I was wrong. I can’t even wear my Bose ones anymore because I’m so used to how comfortable these are, the sound quality, and how great the noise-cancelling is!

Hopefully this helps a little bit if you research a lot too!

author: Laura
title: Better then Iphone earbuds
content: I can not believe how great these are. Better then the i phone ear buds. They do not fall out the sound quality is so amazing. I bout a pair and my son was so impressed he ordered a pair the next day. Pairs easily and has a battery life of 7 plus hours.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great value overall
content: I did some research about earbuds before I purchased these. Ultimately, I chose the Galaxy buds because reviews said they had the best sound quality at a great price. I have not been disappointed. The sound quality is surprisingly rich, especially when you consider how small they are. The little rubber tips help to block out a lot of ambient noise. The setting that allows you to hear ambient noise works pretty well, I just don't like how it sounds. Since the last update, the touch gestures work very well. Heads up, DON'T DROP THE POD. I was walking down the street and pulled the case out and dropped it...both earbuds flew out in different directions into my neighbor's bushes 😩 Luckily it didn't take me long to find them. I wish the case snapped closed. Otherwise,  I have no complaints.
